title: Lithium Battery Ban? Check Again
description: If you have been reading reports of the Federal Aviation Adminstration ban on lithium batteries on airliners, dont get too excited.

title: New Years Day Bowl Matchups
description: This is simply the best day of the year for the college football fan. Intriguing matchups from 11 in the morning until 8 at night. Of course, you cant sleep on the Fiesta Bowl. Will Hawaii be able to recreate what Boise State did last season? How will the Big Ten fare against tough non-conference opponents? Does Illinois have a shot against U.S.C. in the Rose Bowl? Can Missouri get over being slighted for a B.C.S. game and beat Arkansas in the Cotton Bowl? What kind of game will the Heisman Trophy winner Tim Tebow have against Michigan in the Capital One Bowl? Whats going on with Darren McFadden? The only way to get to the bottom of any of this is by sitting on your couch and watching a lot of football. Whats so hard about that? The rest of the games are prime-time affairs so this is the last full day of college football until next fall. Enjoy.Outback Bowl11 a.m., No. 18 Wisconsin (9-3) vs. No. 16 Tennessee (9-4), Tampa, Fla., ESPN

title: Eight Years, And Back To The Start
description: If you fled Wall Street eight years ago  remember Y2K?  and came back today, you might conclude that nothing much happened while you were gone.

title: Tackling Clutter to Improve Your Health
description: Being disorganized is frustrating. But it can also stand in the way of better health.

title: World Juniors: U.S. and Sweden Run the Table in the First Round
description: Do you believe in omens?

title: Mitt Romney's Recent Movement
description: For over a month, Mitt Romney has been well behind Mike Huckabee in Iowa. But that's changed in the last few days.

title: A Change of Plans
description: MUSCATINE, Iowa  No one likes to cancel a big campaign rally in Iowa just three days before the states presidential caucuses, but Hillary Rodham Clinton scratched a rally in Waterloo this evening because of bad weather and headed back to Des Moines instead.

title: Colt Brennans Sugar Bowl Q&A
description: NEW ORLEANS  Faithful readers of The Quad know that along with rewriting the N.C.A.A. record book during his three years at Hawaii, Colt Brennan has evolved into one of the more open and honest interviews in college sports. (Brennan has even found time to moonlight as a blogger.) His disarming honesty had the news media wide-eyed here this week. Brennan even told a group of reporters he wasnt a role model by saying, Im a convicted felon.

title: Obama Pulls Ahead in Register Poll
description: DES MOINES  The highly anticipated final poll from The Des Moines Register is out and it has some surprising news: Senator Barack Obama appears to have widened his lead over his Democratic rivals, with Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton coming in second and former Senator John Edwards a close third.

title: New Years Eve in Ames With Obama
description: Updated AMES, Iowa  Senator Barack Obama was running late and the meatballs were running out  neither of which seemed to matter when word spread through the crowd at his New Years Eve party here that he was leading by 7 points in the final Des Moines Register poll before Thursdays caucuses.

title: Clinton Raises $100 Million in 2007
description: DES MOINES  Hillary Rodham Clintons presidential campaign raised more than $100 million in total for 2007, her advisers said Monday night, in addition to $10 million that she transferred from her old Senate campaign account.

title: Iowa Is Suddenly News Central
description: Talk about a media event.

title: Winnowing the Debate Field
description: The debate stage, it seems, will be getting a little roomier. Invitations to participate are getting harder to come by in 2008.

title: Despite One Failure, Growth Is Seen in Coachless Flights
description: Maxjet Airways, a pioneer as a discount all-business-class airline, failed Dec. 24. Is the concept that it helped invent two years ago fated to die as well?

title: Short-Handed Florida St. Cant Get Past Kentucky
description: NASHVILLE  Florida State Coach Bobby Bowden watched his team, down by two touchdowns, claw at Kentucky in the fourth quarter and he wondered where that spirit his players were showing had been hiding.

title: No Gimmicks: Eat Less and Exercise More
description: A desire to turn over a new, more healthful leaf typically accompanies the start of a new year. My mail, for example, has been inundated with diet books, most of which offer yet another gimmick aimed ultimately at getting the gullible reader to eat less and exercise more.

title: U.S. Clears Sale of a Stake in Nasdaq
description: Nasdaq Stock Market obtained clearance on Monday from the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States to sell a stake to Borse Dubai, paving the way for Nasdaqs eventual acquisition of the OMX exchange in Stockholm.

title: China: Baidu Shares Fall on Executives Death
description: Shares of Baidu.com, owner of Chinas most popular Internet search site, fell after the death of its chief financial officer, Shawn Wang. Mr. Wang died in an accident on Thursday, the company said in a statement on Saturday. A group of senior managers will take on his duties until a successor is named. Under Mr. Wang, Baidus shares soared past $400 in the United States last month, a 15-fold gain from their initial price of $27. The company has expanded its market share in China, taking 61 percent of Web queries to Googles 24 percent, according to Analysys International in Beijing. Baidu fell $9.07, to $389.80 in New York. Baidu is the only Chinese company in the Nasdaq 100 index, which consists of the 100 biggest nonfinancial companies by market value listed on the Nasdaq.

title: Outdoor Game a Reminder of Roots, but Also a Peek at the Sports Future
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y.  In an odd tableau for hockey, or for a fashion show, the Buffalo Sabres emerged from the end-zone tunnel at Ralph Wilson Stadium on Monday walking in their skates on a rubber runway, wearing turtlenecks, eye black and every conceivable kind of winter headgear.

title: Road to Nowhere
description: The most impressive thing about Mitt Romney is his clarity of mind. When he set out to pursue his partys nomination, he studied the contours of the Republican coalition and molded himself to its forms.

title: Stocks Slip, Ending Year of Turmoil
description: Stocks fell on Monday, ending a tumultuous year that battered financial firms but left other pockets of the market and the world with stunning gains.

title: Canada: Buyout Challenged Over Racial Bias
description: The Royal Bank of Canadas proposed $1.6 billion acquisition of Alabama National BanCorp was challenged by a group that claimed the Canadian bank engages in discriminatory lending. A financial advocacy group for poor consumers, Fair Finance Watch, said it asked the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond, Va., in a letter for hearings and all documents relating to the proposed buyout. The Royal Bank agreed on Sept. 6 to buy Alabama National for cash and stock. Fair Finance Watch claimed that in 2006 Royal Banks RBC Centura unit denied mortgage refinance applications in Charlotte, N.C., to blacks 4.4 times more frequently than whites. The group said in the Atlanta area, RBC Centura denied home improvement mortgage applications of blacks 4.2 times more frequently than whites. A bank spokeswoman, Judi Levita, said the lending practices of RBC Centura satisfactorily comply with all applicable requirements.

title: Bloomberg in 08? If So, Paper Chase Starts Soon
description: In Colorado, all you need is $500 and youre in. In Texas, you must gather 74,000 signatures from registered voters within 75 days  and none of them can have voted in the last party primaries.

title: Boys Brother, 16, Believes Bullet Was Meant for Him
description: The teenage brother of an 11-year-old Queens boy who was shot in the chest on Sunday night after he answered the front door of their home said he believed that the bullet had been intended for him.

title: Michigan Will Miss Carr When Hes Gone
description: Happy New Year, Michigan football! Old school is only 60 game minutes from being out, one Lloyd Carr Retirement Classic away.

title: Corzine to Tour State for Plan to Cut Debt With Toll Roads
description: Gov. Jon S. Corzine is hitting the road to build public support for his much-anticipated plan to reduce New Jerseys debt by refinancing the states toll roads.

title: No Picky Eaters Among Successful Argentine Ants
description: The Argentine ant is a very successful invasive species, having conquered territories far from its native South America. Once introduced, inadvertently, by people, it marches across the landscape, displacing local ant species and making an agricultural pest of itself.

title: The New Years Cocktail: Regret With a Dash of Bitters
description: The ideal New Years Eve party would come with a psychological voucher, redeemable the next day for a post-mortem session with friends. A chance to relish the nights humiliations, take bets on who went home with whom, and nominate the guest most in need of therapy, present company included.

title: Fund Frozen, Florida Towns Feel the Pinch
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  On Nov. 28, Marcia L. Dedert, finance director of this rapidly growing city, called the administrators of Floridas state-run investment pool to ask whether it was still safe to park her citys money there. She was hearing talk of urgent withdrawals by others worried about the pools investments in debt related to subprime mortgages.

title: Chasing a Shadowy Imp, Garca Lorcas Muse
description: GRANADA, Spain  Federico Garca Lorca called it el duende  in Spanish, the elf  a dark, irrational muse that leads artists to tragic depths. This dangerous goblin, who delights in the tiny weeds of death, as the early-20th-century Spanish poet and dramatist said in a lecture in Havana, haunted the streets of Garca Lorcas Poet in New York and the moonlit night of Blood Wedding. It refused to take pity on the barren wombs, the weeping guitars or the silver-eyed Gypsy women of other Garca Lorca works.

title: Congressman Named to Fill Lotts Senate Seat
description: Gov. Haley Barbour of Mississippi appointed a seven-term congressman, Roger Wicker, to fill the seat of departing Senator Trent Lott on Monday, opting for a conservative Republican who was a major figure in the partys 1994 takeover of the House of Representatives.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: Because of an editing error, an article in Business Day on Monday about Nintendos video game consoles misstated the capabilities of one of the devices. A statement about movie-playing should have referred to the PlayStation Portable or PSP, made by Sony, not to the hand-held Nintendo DS. (The DS does not play movies.) The article also misspelled the surname of the president and chief operating officer of Nintendo of America. He is Reggie Fils-Amie, not Fils-Aimee.

title: In Reversal, Pakistan Welcomes Outside Help With  Inquiry on Bhutto
description: WASHINGTON  Pakistans ambassador to the United States said Monday that his government would welcome outside experts to help investigate the assassination of Benazir Bhutto, reversing Pakistans earlier rejection of international help.

title: Designing Clinical Tests (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Could It Get Worse for the Knicks? Amazingly, Yes
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  New Years Eve is a natural time to reflect on the past and look forward to what lies ahead. So on the day the calendar turned to another year, it was time for the Knicks to ponder the mess they had created and perhaps wonder whether things might get even worse.

title: What Should We Tax?
description: To the Editor:

title: Fighting Intensifies After Election in Kenya
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Kenya sank deeper into trouble on Monday, with a curfew imposed in Kisumu, the countrys third-largest city, ethnic fighting intensifying and more than 100 people killed in election-related violence.

title: The Claim: Drinking Makes You Warmer in Winter
description: THE FACTS

title: Huckabee Shows Negative Spot After Pulling It From Television
description: DES MOINES  In a bizarre bit of political theater, Mike Huckabee told news outlets on Monday that he was not going to broadcast a negative commercial against Mitt Romney, his chief rival in the Republican presidential caucuses in Iowa. Then he showed that advertisement to the news media, which in reporting the announcement went on to give his anti-Romney message free publicity while he claimed the moral high ground.

title: Gunshot Wounds Girl, 3
description: A 3-year-old girl was grazed by a bullet as she rode in the back of a car driven by her father in the Bronx last night, the police said. The girl, whose name was not released, was in stable condition at Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Center with a shoulder wound, said Detective John Sweeney, a police spokesman.

title: A Once-Easy Campaign Becomes a Test for Romney
description: DES MOINES  Just before Thanksgiving, Mitt Romney woke up to a disquieting new reality. After spending millions of dollars to ensure what was shaping up as a relatively easy victory in Iowa, his own polls found that Mike Huckabee had slipped ahead of him here, threatening his candidacy for the Republican presidential nomination with a devastating defeat.

title: On a Remote Path to Cures
description: NINACACA, Peru  High in the Peruvian Andes, a shaman rubs a fluffy white rabbit all over Chris Kilhams body, murmuring in Quechua, the language of these barren plains. Then she slits the animals throat and lets the blood run into a tiny grave.

title: When Societies Fail (3 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: Merry Mayhem Movies?
description: To the Editor:

title: Still Reeling After All These Years
description: It promised to be a very good year. But then anything would be better than 1967, with its angry kids burning the flag, and the war raging, and American cities going up in flames one after another.

title: Lawyer for Clemens Explains Strategy
description: In a lengthy conversation Friday with Rusty Hardin, Roger Clemenss lawyer, I was particularly interested in his answers to two questions. To Hardins credit, he answered both candidly with no attempt to obfuscate the answers with typical lawyerly prattle.

title: When Its Time to Call the Cavalry
description: Business travelers looking to smooth their itineraries might take some advice from those highly influential executives who always seem to know whom to call when they lose their passport or want a discount on a private jet.

title: Rebounds
description: Stephon Marbury again practiced with the team, but did not talk with reporters. The Knicks said he would not speak publicly until after he plays his next game. He has had three stints of bereavement leave. ... Jamal Crawford practiced but was limited to shooting and drills as he wore a protective glove. He is questionable for Wednesday.

title: Israel: Olmert Curbs Settlements
description: Prime Minister Ehud Olmert has sent a letter to defense, housing and agriculture ministers, saying that his and the defense ministers authorization would be required for any new building, planning or land expropriation for Jewish settlements in the West Bank. The instruction is intended to prevent surprises that could derail peace talks with the Palestinians. It does not apply to East Jerusalem, which Israel has annexed, or to West Bank projects already approved, a spokesman said.

title: China to Shift $20 Billion as Capital for Policy Bank
description: The China Investment Corporation, the countrys $200 billion wealth fund, will inject $20 billion into China Development Bank, as the government nears the end of a decade-long reorganization of the banking industry.

title: Can They Stay Out of Harms Way?
description: The morning was just starting to heat up when a biologist, Ricardo Costa, set out to look for jaguars on Fazenda San Francisco, a 30,000-acre cattle ranch, rice farm and wildlife reserve in the region of southwest Brazil known as the Pantanal.

title: A Writer, a Muse, Their Laundry
description: Years ago the Central European writer Ludwig Bemelmans wrote a story about a poor man who went shopping for his own funeral, only to conclude, as the salesman ran down the catalog from grand to plain, that he couldnt manage any of them. At the end, now dead, he walks to the cemetery, carrying a single candle, his coffin tucked under one arm.

title: Hawaii Hoping to Be This Years Boise State
description: NEW ORLEANS  Boise States upset of Oklahoma in the Fiesta Bowl last season resonates as one of the most exciting and important games in college football history.

title: Writers Return Gives CBS a Head Start
description: In the first competitive move in what may become an A-list booking-war blitz, David Letterman has landed the comedian and film star Robin Williams as the first guest when The Late Show returns to CBS television Wednesday night.

title: Campaigns Feeling Effects of Iowa Poll
description: DES MOINES   Dennis Kucinich today urged his supporters in Iowa to back Senator Barack Obama as their second choice at the caucuses Thursday if his support is not strong enough to be viable in the 1,781 precincts across the state.

title: Colorado Highway Closing Strands 2,000 Travelers
description: DENVER  Thousands of travelers were stranded in Colorado on Monday after gusting winds, blowing snow and the threat of avalanches forced the closing of a 70-mile stretch of mountain highway just west of Denver.

title: A Punishing Sun, a Mystery Treatment, and Happy Faces
description: PEOPLE assume I live a pampered life, jet setting from spa to spa where beauty experts coddle me with the best new treatments. The irony is that I am in the business of pampering but rarely have the opportunity to indulge myself.

title: For U.S.C. and Illinois, Upsets Arent Foreign
description: PASADENA, Calif.  What better way to ring out college footballs Year of the Upset than with the Rose Bowl pairing of Southern California and Illinois, teams whose involvement in 2007s most stunning reversals helped give the year its identity?

title: Oil in North Dakota Brings Job Boom and Burdens
description: STANLEY, N.D.  At dawn, people from faraway states huddle outside the Mountrail County courthouse here, the coldest ones leaving briefcases and books to secure their spots for the moment it opens.

title: In a Car, a Lesson in Russian-European Trade
description: BERLIN  The Skoda, a Czech-made car that was long the butt of jokes across Eastern Europe, has become popular in Moscow, a sign that trade between Eastern Europe and its giant neighbor is at last beginning to pick up, economists say.

title: Pests and Pestilence
description: Q. Are common cockroaches carriers of disease?

title: On Field or on Bench, Beckham Delivered
description: For better or worse, soccer in 2007, at least in the United States, was the Year of Beckham. David Beckham joined the Los Angeles Galaxy of Major League Soccer in a deal valued at $250 million over five years. He played sparingly because of injuries, but was marketed brilliantly and ceaselessly.

title: Recognizing Stripes, Not Faces, Software Tracks Whale Sharks
description: Facial recognition software holds great promise, but the jury is still out on how effective it is now. The software, which compares patterns from an electronic image of a face to a database of images, hasnt proved particularly good at picking criminals out of a crowd, for instance.

title: Edward Brennan, Who Led Sears at Its Peak, Dies at 73
description: Edward A. Brennan, who became chairman and chief executive of Sears, Roebuck & Company in the 1980s, when it was a financial and retail conglomerate, and then presided over its downsizing, died Thursday at his home in Burr Ridge, Ill. He was 73.

title: Putting a Plague in Perspective
description: Cambridge, Mass.

title: Tax the Chewing Gum
description: To the Editor:

title: Collision on Ohio Highway Kills 5 Members of a Family
description: CINCINNATI  A woman and four children traveling home to Maryland from Michigan were killed on an Ohio highway when their minivan was struck by a pickup truck being driven the wrong way by a man whose blood-alcohol level registered three times the legal limit, the authorities said Monday.

title: In 2008, a 100 Percent Chance of Alarm
description: Id like to wish you a happy New Year, but Im afraid I have a different sort of prediction.

title: Wielding a Cost-Cutting Ax, and Often, at NASA
description: WASHINGTON  In Washington, it almost seems radical  completing government projects at their original budgeted cost.

title: Rediscovering a Heroine of Chicago Architecture
description: If women are underrepresented in the architecture profession in 2008, a century ago they were hardly represented at all.

title: Gay Muslims Pack a Dance Floor of Their Own
description: BERLIN  Six men whirled faster and faster in the center of the nightclub, arms slung over one anothers shoulders, performing a traditional circle dance popular in Turkey and the Middle East. Nothing unusual given the German capitals large Muslim population.

title: Batteries Included in New Travel Restrictions
description: BATTERY RESTRICTIONS Beginning Tuesday, airline passengers cannot pack any loose lithium batteries in checked bags, though the batteries are permitted if contained within laptops, cellphones or other electronic devices, according to a new rule by the Transportation Department. The department said that loose lithium batteries can short-circuit and create a fire hazard in cargo holds. The new rule also limits to two the number of large-size spare lithium batteries that may be brought on in carry-on bags, but a department spokeswoman says that restriction applies mostly to professional and industrial-use batteries and does not affect most lithium batteries used in consumer electronics like laptops and cellphones.

title: The Year That Was
description: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.

title: The Death Penalty Is Simply Un-American
description: To the Editor:

title: Darker 2008 for Detroits Automakers
description: DETROIT  The way that auto executives here have been talking, 2008 will be a bad year to sell cars and trucks in the United States. Every time one company predicts how the industry will fare, another seems to come up with an even more dismal number.

title: Correction
description: An Op-Ed article on Sunday, about the bicentennial of the banning of slave importations into the United States, misstated the span of time since the end of World War II. The year 2005 was the 60th anniversary of that wars end, not the 50th.

title: Connecticut Is Criticized on Spending on Smoking
description: STAMFORD, Conn.  The refrain is a familiar one: Each year, the countrys biggest tobacco companies have provided a bonanza to the states under a $246 billion legal settlement struck nine years ago, and each year a chorus of health care experts, nonprofit groups and policy makers, and even a major tobacco company, question where all the money went.

title: Fewer Killings in 2007, but Still Felt in Citys Streets
description: A man was shot in the face in front of his wife and children on a street near his home. A teenager in the Bronx died from stab wounds. And in a Brooklyn apartment, two men were found dead seated at a card table, still clutching their playing cards. Each had been shot in the head.

title: Iraqi Revelers Embrace the New Year
description: BAGHDAD  Firecrackers and machine-gun fire echoed over the capital hours before midnight on Monday as partygoers put aside fears of suicide bombers and gunmen to bring in the new year.

title: One of Fords Would-Be Assassins Is Paroled
description: LOS ANGELES  Sara Jane Moore, a 1970s radical who tried to assassinate President Gerald R. Ford more than 30 years ago, was released Monday on parole from a federal prison in Northern California.

title: The Lure of Addictions and the Mysterious Transmigration of Red
description: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater is rich with fine performers these days, both established and rising stars. On Sunday night at City Center, new casting in two of the seasons revivals suggested just how richly nuanced performances by these dancers can be.

title: Ettore Sottsass, Designer, Is Dead at 90
description: Ettore Sottsass, an minence grise of postmodern design who helped found the influential Memphis Group and was responsible for the familiar bright red plastic Olivetti typewriter, died Monday at his home in Milan. He was 90.

title: Vonage and Nortel End Skirmish Over Patents
description: The Vonage Holdings Corporation, the Internet phone-service provider, said Monday that it had resolved a patent dispute with the Nortel Networks Corporation that had threatened to shut down some Vonage calling features.

title: Big Cats in Captivity
description: To the Editor:

title: Carrying On Mothers Legacy by Caring for a Child
description: The end was near, and Elizabeth Jones seemed to know it. Ms. Jones had just been released from what had become her grim second home  the hospital  and she decided it was time for a barbecue.

title: Nets Hire Vandeweghe as Special Assistant
description: The Nets announced Monday that they had hired Kiki Vandeweghe to become a special assistant to Rod Thorn, the teams president, and Thorn sounded as if he would eventually like to see Vandeweghe become the Nets next general manager.

title: Lottery Numbers
Disparities: Obesity and the Odds of a Kidney Transplant
description: Researchers may have found one more way in which fat people suffer discrimination. The higher the body mass index, they report, the less likely a person is to receive a kidney transplant.

title: Elder Issues
description: To the Editor:

title: Texas High School Coaches Keep Date With Clemens
description: Roger Clemens has received the benefit of the doubt from at least one group.

title: NASA Offers Airline Safety Data
description: WASHINGTON  NASA on Monday released an intentionally scrambled, partly deleted version of the safety data it gathered from 24,000 interviews with airline pilots, making good on a promise to Congress to make public information that it said earlier this year would shake public confidence in the airlines and threaten their commercial interest.

title: Arts, Briefly
description: Robert Frost Home Vandalized

title: With the Jets Season Over, Penningtons Status Is the Biggest Puzzle
description: HEMPSTEAD, N.Y.  By the time Chad Pennington entered the Jets locker room, teammates had already packed their belongings into trash bags. Only the news media remained. Reporters stood four deep around his locker.

title: Children: Study Ties Too Little Sleep With Too Much Weight
description: A study of 7-year-olds has found that sleeping less than nine hours a night was associated with being overweight or obese, even after accounting for amounts of television watching and physical exercise.

title: Transmeridian to Be Acquired
description: Transmeridian Exploration Inc., the Houston oil company with production in Kazakhstan, agreed on Monday to be acquired and taken private by a company formed by its chief executive, Lorrie T. Olivier.

title: Outside Groups Spend Heavily and Visibly to Sway 08 Races
description: DES MOINES  Spurred by a recent Supreme Court decision, independent political groups are using their financial muscle and organizational clout as never before to influence the presidential race, pumping money and troops into early nominating states on behalf of their favored candidates.

title: A Crackdown on Recycling Spurs Some Vigilance
description: With a cold wind whipping across the back of his neck and against his uncovered, balding head, Jorge Soto stood outside of the apartment building where he works, carefully tearing through dozens of dark, sagging trash bags in search of soda cans, glass bottles, plastic containers and cardboard.

title: The One Environmental Issue
description: The overriding environmental issue of these times is the warming of the planet. The Democratic hopefuls in the 2008 campaign are fully engaged, calling for large  if still unquantified  national sacrifices and for a transformation in the way the country produces and uses energy. The Republicans do not go much further than conceding that climate change could be a problem and, with the notable exception of John McCain, offer no comprehensive solutions.

title: Exercise: Better Than the Couch, but Not Equal to the Court
description: The active video games played on the Nintendo Wii console may provide more exercise than its Microsoft rival the Xbox 360, a small British study has found, but they are not a substitute for the real thing.

title: Years Notables
description: PLAYER The Italian Fabio Capello, 61, was only the second non-British coach to take over Englands national team. England has not won a major tournament since playing host to the World Cup ... in 1966. Capello has won league titles with A.C. Milan, Real Madrid, Roma and Juventus (and played for Italy in the 1974 World Cup). He faces the unenviable task of dealing with the ravenous English tabloids.

title: Migration, Interrupted: Natures Rhythms at Risk
description: The world is etched with invisible paths, the routes taken each year by uncountable swarms of geese, elk and salmon, of dragonflies, zebras and leatherback turtles.

title: Stock Exchanges Are in Talks to Buy Stake in Taiwan Board
description: The chairman of the Taiwan Stock Exchange Corporation, Wu Rong-I, said that the exchange, Asias seventh-biggest equities market, planned to sell a stake of as much as 25 percent of itself to overseas bourses.

title: Nights of ONeill
description: The ONeill Festival at Ten, 10 nights of free readings, screenings and musical events featuring Zoe Caldwell, Charles Durning, Brian Murray, Natasha Richardson, Marian Seldes and KT Sullivan, will take place at the Provincetown Playhouse on Macdougal Street in Greenwich Village from Friday through Jan. 13. Presented by the Playwrights Theater and sponsored by the ONeill at Yale project of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, the festival will include the films Long Days Journey Into Night with Katharine Hepburn and Jason Robards; Ah, Wilderness!; The Hairy Ape; and Anna Christie, with Greta Garbo. Live performances will begin on Jan. 11 with a program titled ONeill: Playwright and His Mother, featuring excerpts from plays read by Ms. Caldwell and Ms. Seldes and a post-reading discussion conducted by the ONeill scholar Barbara Gelb. The 10th anniversary presentation of the festival, begun with the intention of staging all 50 of ONeills plays in order, will conclude with performances of the 18th and 19th: In the Zone and Ile. Information and reservations: eugeneoneill.net.

title: The Super Lottery Is No Prize
description: The chance to bet your hard-earned money at unfavorable odds was once mostly limited to casinos in Nevada and Atlantic City. Today there are slot machines on Native American reservations from California to Connecticut and poker on casino boats on the Mississippi.

title: After Way Too Many Toasts to 2008
description: To the Editor:

title: Travelers to Pay $6 Million, Ending Inquiry on Brokers Fees
description: Travelers Companies, the commercial insurer, reached an agreement with attorneys general from several states to pay $6 million to resolve an investigation into fees it paid to brokers.

title: Before Carrs Finale, Career Is Remembered
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  After Michigan plays Florida in the Capital One Bowl on Tuesday, Lloyd Carr will retire after 13 years as head coach of the Wolverines and 40 seasons in his profession. To those who have known him, he has clearly left a mark.

title: In 2007, Some Giants Went Smaller
description: Bigger is better, right?

title: Singapore: Growth Is Slowing, but Is Still Strong
description: Singapores economy expanded 7.5 percent in 2007, at the lower end of the governments forecast range, Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said. Growth eased from 7.9 percent in 2006 and is expected to slow further to as little as 4.5 percent next year. Mr. Lee, left, warned that the United States economy may enter a recession next year amid financial market turmoil. A U.S. downturn would affect Asia too, but the impact on us would be offset somewhat by the strong momentum in the dynamic Asian economies, Mr. Lee said. The full-year growth figure suggests that the $132 billion Southeast Asian economy may have contracted in the fourth quarter on an annualized basis, analysts said.

title: Democrats Fill Day Campaigning Before Ringing In 08
description: DES MOINES  The Democratic presidential candidates used the last day of 2007 to drive home their final messages to Iowa voters, while calibrating expectations on how they will perform in the caucuses three days later.

title: Ultimate Report on Manning Is to Come
description: It has been nearly a year since the Giants put a double-team squeeze on quarterback Eli Manning. When the franchise decided to retain Tom Coughlin as coach last January, the teams president and co-owner, John Mara, said a major part of our discussions centered on finding a way to get Manning to play more consistently.

title: Still Playing and Winning at 35
description: Fabrice Santoro, the oldest singles player competing regularly on the ATP Tour, began what may be his last season Monday at the Qatar Open. Santoro, a 35-year-old Frenchman, beat Andreas Seppi of Italy, 6-4, 1-6, 6-2. Assuming that Santoro remains healthy before the Australian Open, which begins Jan. 14, he will break Andre Agassis record of playing in 61 Grand Slam events.

title: Buffett May Not Testify in General Re Case
description: The billionaire Warren E. Buffett, who is on the prosecution witness list in the criminal trial of Ronald E. Ferguson, former chief executive of General Reinsurance Corporation, may not be called to testify, the government said in court filings Monday.

title: Killing Dogs in Training of Doctors Is to End
description: By next month, all American medical schools will have abandoned a time-honored method of teaching cardiology: operating on dogs to examine their beating hearts, and disposing of them after the lesson.

title: Chief Justice Again Calls for Pay Raise for Judges
description: WASHINGTON  Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. on Monday renewed his call for a pay increase for federal judges. A measure now moving through Congress with bipartisan support is vital and long overdue, the chief justice said in his annual report on the state of the federal judiciary.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An article on Thursday about John McCains relationship with his children misstated, in some editions, the site of a graduation ceremony for Mr. McCains son Jimmy, which was attended by several siblings. Jimmy McCain graduated from Marine boot camp; there is no Marine Academy.

title: Bush Signs Bill Allowing Sudan Divestment
description: CRAWFORD, Tex.  President Bush signed legislation on Monday allowing state and local governments to cut investment ties with companies doing business in Sudan, even as he expressed concerns that the bill could interfere with his right to set foreign policy.

title: Gaza: 5 Dead in Hamas-Fatah Clashes
description: Five Palestinians were killed and about 30 were wounded in armed clashes between Fatah supporters and Hamas policemen, according to news agency reports. The clashes broke out in Khan Yunis and spread to other parts of Gaza as Fatah commemorated the 43rd anniversary of its founding. Hamas had banned any anniversary rallies. Medical officials said the dead included a 12-year-old boy and a Hamas policeman.

title: A Slippery Slope Is the Secret Weapon of Some Pitcher Plants
description: A pitcher plant is a devilish organism, digesting ants and other insects that are attracted to the lip of its pitcher  a bowl-shaped leaf with liquid in the bottom  only to slip and fall into it.

title: Tebow Faces Tough Defense, and Doubters
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Quarterback Tim Tebow of Florida won the Heisman Trophy this season, the only sophomore ever to do so. Shawn Crable, a senior Michigan linebacker, does not seem terribly impressed.

title: Reaching Drug Users
description: To the Editor:

title: Uncertain Prospects for Radiohead CD
description: LOS ANGELES  In Rainbows, the latest album from the British rock band Radiohead, has been readily available to music fans for almost three months, first as a digital download in an unconventional tip-jar offering in which fans decided for themselves what to pay for it, and then, like most pop music today, as digital files circulating on free, unlicensed file-swapping networks. One matter remains: Will anyone buy the CD?

title: News Summary
description: INTERNATIONALA3-8

title: Breast Cancer and Choices (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 More Marine Trials in Killings of 17 Iraqis
description: A Marine infantryman accused of killing 17 Iraqi civilians during a combat maneuver in Haditha in late 2005 will be tried by court-martial on charges of voluntary manslaughter but will avoid more serious murder charges originally pressed against him, the Marine Corps announced Monday.

title: The Korean Card Trick: Picking One
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Whenever Park Kyung Jin goes shopping, she methodically reviews which of her many credit cards to pull out. Not that Ms. Park, a 28-year-old office worker, is a shopaholic; rather, like millions of other South Koreans, she knows this is a way to trim costs.

title: Aging: For Uninsured, Medicare Makes a Healthy Impact
description: Uninsured people 55 and older, particularly those with diabetes and cardiovascular disease, significantly reduce their risk of declining health after they enroll in Medicare at 65.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: The Quotation of the Day on Monday, taken from a front-page article about the selection of Benazir Bhuttos son to head Pakistans largest political party, carried an incorrect attribution in some editions. It was Asif Ali Zardari, the widower of Ms. Bhutto, who was killed on Thursday, who said: Its not an easy chair to sit on. A, she leaves me. B, she ties me in this. To say the least, its overbearing. The comment was not by Ms. Bhuttos son, Bilawal Bhutto Zardari. (Go to Article)

title: A Family Album Is One for the History Books
description: The old photo albums were such a familiar part of the Woods familys Adirondack camp that no one paid them much notice. But when the 21-year-old James T. Stever took a closer look at the nearly 1,000 rare photographs that his great-great-grandfather Harry Fowler Woods had taken a century ago, he saw them with fresh eyes.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An obituary on Monday about Marvin Wachman, the former president of Lincoln and Temple Universities, misstated the date of his death and misspelled the given name of his wife and the middle name of his daughter. Dr. Wachman died on Dec. 23, not Dec. 22. His wife is Adeline Wachman, not Adelina, and his daughter is Lynn Alison Wachman, not Lynn Allison. The obituary also omitted the cause of death. Dr. Wachman died of congestive heart failure, his wife said.

title: This King, This Courtier, These Kevin Klines
description: The year just past was a notable one in the career  and surely also the life  of Kevin Kline. Notably busy, and at times disappointing. But ultimately, and happily, triumphant.

title: A Tale of Political Dirty Tricks Makes the Case for Election Reform
description: In New Hampshires hotly contested 2002 Senate race, Democratic get-out-the-vote phone banks were jammed with incoming calls on Election Day. The Republican John Sununu, won re-election by under 20,000 votes, and Allen Raymond, a Republican Party operative, went to jail for his role in the jamming.

title: A Complex Family History, Unfolding in Public
description: NAUDERO, Pakistan  On Sunday evening, as a three-day mourning period drew to a close, Asif Ali Zardari sat with his back to the tiled wall, under a sparkling pink chandelier, in a mansion filled with mementos of his wifes legendary father, and described discovering how meticulously she had prepared for the aftermath of her death.

title: Religious and Liberal
description: To the Editor:

title: A Clutter Too Deep for Mere Bins and Shelves
description: After the holidays, many shoppers load up their carts with storage bins, shelving systems and color-coded containers, all in a resolute quest to get organized for the new year.

title: Open Season on Coaches: Ravens Are First to Fire
description: The day after the N.F.L. regular season ends is when playoff teams turn their attention to their next opponents and everybody else starts trying to make next seasons playoffs. The Baltimore Ravens decided they would have a better chance of success without Brian Billick, who was fired Monday after the Ravens finished 5-11.

title: Jurys Deliberations May Be a Focal Point of Appeal
description: At the beginning of deliberations, the panel weighing the fate of a black man from Long Island charged with manslaughter turned to its lone black juror for guidance.

title: Bhutto Spouse, Divisive Figure, Asserts Himself
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  It took only a few minutes before the real balance of power between Benazir Bhuttos son and husband made itself clear at a news conference held Sunday. As the new chairman of the party, her son was asked the first question. Right afterward, his father cut him off.

title: New Yorkers Crossing East River Lose Water Taxi for the Winter
description: The new year ushers out two of New York Citys ferry services and welcomes a new one.

title: Explain a Medical Error? Sure. Apologize Too?
description: One morning not long ago, I got a call from the emergency room at my hospital. A young man  an intern, in fact, who had been on rounds that morning  had been admitted with chest pains. Could I come to evaluate him?

title: Opponent Calls for Musharraf to Quit at Once
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  The most experienced opposition politician in Pakistan, Nawaz Sharif, upped the ante in the coming confrontation with the governing party on Monday, calling for President Pervez Musharrafs immediate resignation and the formation of a government of national consensus.

title: What if Iowa Settles Nothing for Democrats?
description: DES MOINES  Iowa is packed with presidential candidates and hundreds of campaign aides, advisers and contributors. Twenty-five hundred representatives of news organizations have been granted credentials to cover the caucuses Thursday night, twice as many as in 2004. Rarely has a political event been so intensely anticipated as a decisive moment, at least on the Democratic side.

title: Giving Disorganized Boys the Tools for Success
description: LOS ALTOS, Calif.  Can we take a look at your backpack?

title: A Family That Beat Anthrax Picks Up the Pieces
description: DANBURY, Conn.  When Ase-AmenRa Kariamu and his wife, Althea, returned to their house here after nearly four months, it neither felt nor looked like home. The odor of chlorine was so powerful that they had to wear masks. A baby portrait of their eldest daughter in an upstairs hallway was a pale bronze, as if a relic from generations past.

title: When Hospitals Kept Children From Parents
description: Early one morning, I visited my daughters 5-year-old friend Eddie, who was laid up in the hospital the night after an emergency appendectomy. Understandably, Eddie looked miserable. Just as understandably, so did his parents, who were still in their pajamas in a fold-out cot next to his bed.

title: The Neediest Cases Fund-Raising Totals
Charges Fly Over Failure to Release 3 in Colombia
description: RIO de JANEIRO  A Venezuelan-led mission to release three hostages held by a Colombian rebel group seemed to be breaking down late Monday, with the Colombian government and the rebels accusing each other of sabotaging the operation.

title: 3 Different Candidates, 3 Distinct Faces of the G.O.P.
description: DES MOINES  As Mitt Romney, Fred S. Thompson and Mike Huckabee hit points all over Iowa in a closing flurry before Thursdays caucuses, it can seem as if they are campaigning in three entirely different worlds.

title: New DVDs
description: HARRY LANGDON

title: Sarkozy Visits Washington
description: International Herald Tribune reporter Katrin Bennhold on President Nicolas Sarkozy of France, who made his first official visit to Washington.

title: New Years Day Links: The Other Shoes Begin to Drop
description: Day 1 of the N.F.L. postseason is usually one of cleaning house. But in that respect, Monday was a relatively slow day. Brian Billick was fired by the Baltimore Ravens after a 5-11 season that included a nine-game losing streak. Rick Maese of The Baltimore Sun said the move was bold but necessary. Len Pasquarelli of ESPN writes that Billick lost his offensive touch. Adam Schefter of the NFL Network suggests Rex Ryan, Baltimores defensive coordinator; Kirk Ferentz, University of Iowa head coach; and Mike Singletary, the 49ers assistant head coach, as possible replacements.

title: Voices From 5th Avenue
description: A weak dollar draws shoppers across the Atlantic.

title: Bowl Pick Em (The Final Edition)
description: It has finally arrived. The stretch run of this unbelievable college football season is upon us as we enter the new year. New Years Day always brings a glut of college football games, and the B.C.S. games that follow over the next few days should be a good way to wrap up a crazy season. It also provides us with one last opportunity to prove how much, or how little, we know. So, as always, feel free to disagree and provide your own picks. As this season has taught us over and over again, you never know whats going to happen.

title: The Best Cleavers
description: Sharpen your chopping skills with a cleaver.

description: The following is a transcript of an interview by Michael Gordon of The New York Times with John Edwards, conducted Sunday on the Edwards campaign bus as it drove between campaign stops in western Iowa. Some of the questions have been edited for brevity and clarity.

title: Marion Mahony
description: Images from "The Magic of America" and "Marion Mahony Griffin: Drawing the Form of Nature."

title: Looking East
description: Images from "William Howard Taft and the 1905 Mission to Asia" at the Nippon Club.

title: The Early Word: 08 Really Starts in 2 More Days
description: Corks popped at midnight in Des Moines last night, Auld Lang Syne was sung, and those involved with Barack Obamas campaign celebrated the results of the last major poll before the caucus that showed he had increased his lead in the state.

title: Did we dodge a bullet?
description: In a recent post I pointed out that up through the third quarter of 2007 rising exports had roughly offset the impact of the housing bust. Heres the chart again. (By the way, all of the data come from the Bureau of Economic Analysis, which has fairly easy-to-use interactive data tables.)

description: Countdown: 7 days until the primary.

description: As the election year officially began, the presidential candidates were delivering their closing arguments in Iowa and New Hampshire, where losses could signal the end for some campaigns.

description: Caucus Countdown: Two days to go. For good luck, get yourself some black-eyed peas and collard greens today.

description: On New Years Day, let us contemplate signs of future weather.

title: For the Moment | Loden Dager
description: This weeks guest bloggers are Loden Dager, a mens wear collective based in New York City that launched in the Fall of 2006. Its members, pictured, are: Melissa Vail, Matthew Sandager, Oliver Helden, Paul Marlow, and Alex Galan. (For more on Galan you can check out The Insider profile published earlier on this blog.) This week Loden Dager writes from the road as they journey to Atlanta in search of inspiration.

title: New Years Day Kickoff: A Beefy Rose Bowl
description: Happy New Year! We hope that you enjoy the long day of college football, which features several interesting matchups that could produce some great games.

title: Paul Raises $19.5 Million
description: Updated For most of the candidates, the fourth quarter was more about stumping than fund-raising. Not so for Representative Ron Paul of Texas, who has achieved that Howard Dean-esque feat of turning fervent netroots support into cold, hard cash. The libertarian-leaning Republican raked in $19.5 million over the last three months, which is likely to be more than any other G.O.P. candidates haul. (As the campaign points out in its release this morning, the figure is over $9 million more than any Republican raised in the third quarter.)

title: A Network for Actuality Shows
description: Court TV has always served up gritty stuff, like courtroom dramas and crime and justice shows. The cable channels new name, truTV, is designed to reflect that, according to Marc Juris, the networks executive vice president and general manager.

title: On the Road: Of Eggs and Frogs
description: ALLISON, Iowa  Sometimes it seems Iowa voters have been reduced to mere table ornaments in a massive media chow-down.

title: McCain on Experience
description: Updated CONCORD, N.H.  Senator John McCain, who has long touted his own experience on matters of national security and foreign policy as top credentials, is now taking the fight directly to Mitt Romney on the topic.

title: Taking Inventory | Holiday Gifts
description: In the days leading up to Christmas, The Moment published  holiday wish lists of several T Magazine staffers. Now that the big day has come and gone, were curious to know what loot they actually received. Heres an update from the senior designer Elizabeth Spiridakis, who was hoping for a vintage Ray Gun magazine, a Miu Miu dress and wooden dice by Geoff McFetridge. She writes:

title: Wooo PIG Sooie!
description: Standing in a trailer of wood shavings at the Cotton Bowl, Arkansas mascot Tusk II was in hog heaven this morning as fans took photos of him eating white grapes.

title: Off Balance Sheet Woes
description: Zions Bancorpororation is taking more losses from an off balance sheet investment vehicle. This is the second time in two weeks that Zions has done that.

title: On the Road: A View From the Bus
description: IOWA FALLS, Iowa  Any reporter who spends time on a press bus rolling down the byways of Iowa will tell a willing listener why the experience, in a word, stinks: long hours on narrow bus seats, cold dinners eaten out of clamshells over a laptop with a dying battery, a different and unremarkable motel every night. (We found seven different room keys in the bottom of our purse this morning.)

title: But Seriously Folks
description: CLIVE, IowaMitt Romney has added a new favorite word, freighted with meaning in the context of his back and forth with rival Mike Huckabee, to his political lexicon today: serious.

title: Kucinich Tells Supporters to Caucus for Obama
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa  Representative Dennis Kucinich urged his Iowa followers today to select Senator Barack Obama as their second choice at the caucuses on Thursday if his support is not strong enough to be viable in the 1,781 precincts across the state.

title: Karachi After Bhutto
description: Pakistanis made fitful attempts to return to normal life in Karachi, the hometown of Benazir Bhutto, after her assassination last week touched off an outbreak of violence.

title: Make Em Laugh
description: AMES, Iowa  Call it post-New Years fun or pre-caucus jitters, but Hillary Rodham Clintons sense of humor  which her friends often recommend when trying to humanize her  was clearly on display today.

title: World Club Top 10: Salavat Stumble
description: Salavat Yulaev Ufa, the top team in Russia and, until this week, the World Club Top 10, did not exactly cover itself in glory over the holiday break. The Bashkir club lost twice to a team of European-based Canadians at the Spengler Cup tournament in Davos, Switzerland, including a defeat in the championship game. Even though both losses were by a single goal, Salavats performance can only be counted as an embarrassment to what had been considered the strongest side on the continent.

title: The Snow Bowl
description: The Winter Classic just ended with a Sidney Crosby shootout goal. The games more thrilling moments involved stops in play when the ice doctors patted and sprayed problematic patches of ice. Would it hold out? As the snow fell more densely, stick handling involved more flakes than puck.

title: Blogtalk: Debates and Elections
description: Ron Paul supporters, already infamous for their avid online presence, are absolutely enraged that their candidate is being left out of the Fox News G.O.P. candidate debate on Sunday, and theres a chance Mr. Paul could be left out of Saturdays ABC forum, too.

title: Huckabee and the Intelligence Report on Iran
description: Mike Huckabee, the former Arkansas Governor, is again making misleading statements about how long he was unaware of a National Intelligence Estimate finding that Iran was not pursuing nuclear weapons.

title: Crisis in Kenya
description: The crisis over the disputed elections in Kenya worsened.

title: More on the Register Poll
description: DES MOINES  The Des Moines Register poll, which showed Senator Barack Obama pulling away from Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton and former Senator John Edwards, had some interesting numbers below the top line. (To refresh your memory: Mr. Obama had 32 percent, Mrs. Clinton 25 percent and Mr. Edwards 24 percent.)

title: Spawning Something Fishy
description: In June 2006, at the invitation of The Times, I spent a month writing a daily online column on matters evolutionary. I called it The Wild Side.

title: Greetings From the Superdome
description: NEW ORLEANS  After a day of watching bowl games, its nice to get settled in the press box here at the Superdome. Players are milling around on the field during pregame warm ups. The Georgia fans just roared in approval as some of their players ran onto the field.

title: Working on the High Line
description: A defunct railway on the far West Side of Manhattan is destined to become a park in the sky.

title: Huckabee Thanks Bloggers
description: DES MOINES _ Mike Huckabee held a little event here on Tuesday to thank the roughly 700 bloggers who, he said, were responsible for keeping his campaign alive. Because he had no money and initially got very little media attention, he said, he could not have kept going without their dedication.

title: Topic: Marbella, Spain
description: An orgy of exaggeration is misrepresenting the market in Marbella and the Costa del Sol, estate agent Christopher Clover argues.

title: Murder Charges Against Tankleff Are Dropped
description: HAUPPAUGE, N.Y.  The Suffolk County District Attorney announced on Wednesday that he was dropping the charges against Martin H. Tankleff for the 1988 murders of his parents and will ask Governor Eliot Spitzer to appoint a special prosecutor to re-investigate the case.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An article on Dec. 26 about Turkish airstrikes on Kurdish rebels in northern Iraq misidentified the area on the Iraqi border where the bombing took place. The area is known as Jamju; it is not Hawler, which is the name of a town and a province whose governor spoke about the numbers of refugees and civilian deaths. (Hawler is the Kurdish word for Erbil.) (Go to Article)

title: Arsenal Stays In First Place
description: Eduardo da Silva scored his fifth goal in three games to help Arsenal to a 2-0 victory over West Ham that kept the Gunners atop the Premier League. With second-place Manchester United beating Birmingham, 1-0, Eduardo and Emmanuel Adebayor scored to keep Arsenal 2 points ahead. Chelsea stayed in third place with a 2-1 victory at Fulham, while Everton, Portsmouth and Aston Villa also won.

title: In Illinois, a Ban Sends Smokers Into the Cold
description: CHICAGO  A strict ban on smoking went into effect in Illinois on Tuesday, sending clusters of bundled smokers here out into frigid temperatures and the thick pile of snow that also arrived with the new year.

title: Mob Sets Kenya Church on Fire, Killing Dozens
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Dozens of people seeking refuge in a church in Kenya were burned to death by a mob on Tuesday in an explosion of ethnic violence that is threatening to engulf this country, which until last week was one of the most stable in Africa.

title: Nearly Blind, and Coping With Shame
description: How do children learn that their parents are ashamed of them?

title: The Perfect Snowstorm: The Winter Classic Scores
description: The National Hockey League needed a game like Tuesdays outdoor Winter Classic. In its fight for the attention of sports fans, it requires events that set it apart. It needed a tight game  this one was won in a shootout by the Penguins star Sidney Crosby  and an entertaining broadcast by NBCs group of exhilarated announcers. It needed to build a regulation-size rink inside Ralph Wilson Stadium in Orchard Park, N.Y., for a game that started in daylight and ended at dusk.

title: Caucuses Empower Only Some Iowans
description: DES MOINES  Jason Huffman has lived in Iowa his whole life. Lately he has been watching presidential debates on the Internet, discussing what he sees with friends and relatives. But when fellow Iowans choose among presidential candidates on Thursday night, he will not be able to vote, because he is serving with the National Guard in western Afghanistan.

title: In Iowa, Edwards Faces His Past and His Future
description: AMES, Iowa  Ever since his surprise second-place finish in the Iowa caucuses in 2004, John Edwards has staked his future in presidential politics on this state. Since 2005, he has spent more than 100 days in Iowa. He has fiercely courted rural voters in particular, visiting all 99 counties  twice.

title: U.S. Isnt Ready to Accept Pakistans Initial Findings
description: WASHINGTON  United States intelligence analysts are not convinced by the evidence offered so far by Pakistani authorities that a militant linked to Al Qaeda was responsible for Benazir Bhuttos assassination, American officials said Tuesday.

title: Oil Hits $100 a Barrel for the First Time
description: HOUSTON  Oil prices briefly reached $100 a barrel on Wednesday, a long-awaited milestone in an era of rapidly escalating energy demand and tightening supplies.

title: A Wild Card for the Playoffs: Heinz Field
description: PITTSBURGH  The good news for Jacksonville Jaguars running back Fred Taylor: The forecast for Saturday nights wild-card game against the Steelers calls for a low of 38 degrees and only a 20 percent chance of rain or snow.

title: The Economy and the New Year
description: As 2008 begins, house prices are still skidding, bank losses are still mounting, oil is again flirting with $100 a barrel and consumers are buying less as prices rise. To many, the wheels appear to be coming off the economy. To others, including President Bush and his aides, the economy is fundamentally sound and resilient.

title: Customers, Not Brokers, Profited in an Odd 2007
description: The brokers customers did reasonably well. The brokers did not.

description: REVISITS

description: PUSH THE PAUSE BUTTON

title: Justice Dept. Sets Criminal Inquiry Into C.I.A. Tapes
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Michael B. Mukasey said Wednesday that the Justice Department had elevated its inquiry into the destruction of Central Intelligence Agency interrogation videotapes into a formal criminal investigation to be headed by an outside prosecutor.

title: For Celebrity Magazine, Pregnancy Is a Bonus
description: OK!, the celebrity magazine, could not possibly have purchased all the attention it enjoyed in late December after it got the scoop that Jamie Lynn Spears, the younger and until then less sensational sister of the troubled pop queen Britney Spears, was three months pregnant.

title: Louis Wolfson, Central to the Fall of a Justice, Is Dead at 95
description: Louis E. Wolfson, a self-made industrialist and financier whose legal troubles were central to the resignation of a Supreme Court justice and who later achieved a cliffhanging sweep of the 1978 Triple Crown as a thoroughbred owner, died Sunday at his home in Bal Harbour, Fla. He was 95.

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening This Week

title: New Coordinator for Louisville
description: Ron English accepted an offer from Louisville Coach Steve Kragthorpe to be his defensive coordinator. It is the same job English had at Michigan, where the incoming coach, Rich Rodriguez, fired all of Lloyd Carrs assistants. English agreed to a two-year contract with Louisville, which fired the defensive coordinator Mike Cassity after a disappointing 6-6 season. The Cardinals finished 84th in the country in total defense and 93rd in scoring defense.

title: Candidates Unleash Final Efforts in Iowa
description: DES MOINES  The presidential candidates began fanning out across Iowa early Wednesday morning  with one, John Edwards, still in the midst of a nonstop 36-hour bus tour  on the final day before the presidential caucuses, courting undecided voters and connecting with supporters to make sure they turn out to caucus Thursday evening.

title: 2007 Was Unpredictable, but Lets Brave 2008 Anyway
description: Like baseball or the weather, the economy can be a difficult thing to predict.

title: Huckabee and Consultant Form an Uneasy Alliance
description: About three weeks ago, Mike Huckabee received an unexpected e-mail message from the veteran political consultant and television commentator Ed Rollins offering help with his unexpectedly surging dark-horse Republican primary campaign. Fifteen minutes later, Mr. Huckabee had signed him up, Mr. Rollins recently recalled.

title: New Rule May Factor Into Bowl Ineligibility
description: The rites of college footballs bowl games are familiar, with debates about national title contenders, a carousel of game sponsors and a smattering of upsets. But another hallmark of the season  incomplete rosters  has drawn considerable attention in recent weeks.

title: Chicago Murder Tied to Caste and Marriage
description: A Chicago-area man set a fire that killed his pregnant daughter, grandson and son-in-law, because he was unhappy with his daughters marriage, prosecutors said.

title: Still Skinny, but Now They Can Cook
description: GRAPEFRUIT, cabbage soup and maple syrup have had their moments. Now a new weight-loss ingredient is all the rage: Rage.

title: Lets Just Say, It Was Crowded
description: How many people rang in the new year at Times Square on Monday night? The simple answer is: One heck of a lot. The complicated answer is: Perhaps only the Police Department knows for sure, and it wont tell you.

title: Doubts Raised on Technology Sales to China
description: WASHINGTON  Six months ago, the Bush administration quietly eased some restrictions on the export of sensitive technologies to China. The new approach was intended to help American companies increase sales of high-tech equipment to China despite tight curbs on sharing technology that might have military applications.

title: Mall Owner in Australia Seeks Buyers for Company
description: The Centro Properties Group, facing a Feb. 15 deadline to refinance 3.9 billion Australian dollars ($3.4 billion) of debt, said Wednesday it is seeking buyers for the company.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 3,891 American service members who have died since the start of the Iraq war. It confirmed the death of the following American on Monday:

title: St. Paul Stops a Waterfront Developer From Crossing the Mississippi
description: ST. PAUL  As manufacturing declined across the country, cities from Baltimore to San Francisco have reclaimed waterfronts for recreation and development. But here along the Mississippi River, an unusual situation has emerged.

title: Pakistans Days of Rage Leave Cloud of Uncertainty
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  The highway that leads from Benazir Bhuttos ancestral village to this, her hometown, is one long road of ruin. Here and there along a stretch of 200 miles lie twisted hulks of tractor-trailers, their contents spilling out on the highway, casualties of the riots that broke out after Ms. Bhuttos assassination last Thursday.

title: New H.I.V. Cases Drop but Rise in Young Gay Men
description: For years he had numbed his pain and fear with drugs, alcohol and anonymous sex. But in a flash of clarity one day, when the crystal meth was wearing off, Javier Arriola dragged himself to a clinic to get an H.I.V. test, years after he stopped using condoms.

description: Following are excerpts from an interview by Michael R. Gordon of The New York Times with John Edwards, conducted Sunday on the Edwards campaign bus as it drove between campaign stops in western Iowa. description: Two agencies in the Department of the Interior are nearing significant yet contradictory decisions that will affect the fate of one of Americas iconic animal species, the polar bear.

title: Chvezs Promised Hostage Release Fizzles, His Second Major Setback in Weeks
description: RIO de JANEIRO  Last week, Venezuelas president, Hugo Chvez, seemed on the verge of one of his biggest triumphs to date. Now, amid renewed acrimony with the Colombian leader, lvaro Uribe, he is staring at his second major political defeat in just over a month.

title: Gang Blamed as 10 Are Killed in Attacks at Nigerian Oil Port
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Coordinated assaults on two police stations, a hotel and a restaurant early Tuesday killed at least 10 people, the authorities said, shattering a brief New Years Day calm in the violent and oil-rich Niger Delta region of Nigeria.

description: An article on Dec. 26 about Turkish airstrikes on Kurdish rebels in northern Iraq misidentified the area on the Iraqi border where the bombing took place. The area is known as Jamju; it is not Hawler, which is the name of a town and a province whose governor spoke about the numbers of refugees and civilian deaths. (Hawler is the Kurdish word for Erbil.)

title: Hungry for a Market, but Where?
description: THE day was wet and so cold that the savoy cabbages nearly froze and the fat on Mario Batalis porchetta quickly congealed into a solid mass. But the few thousand intrepid souls who made their way to the southern tip of Manhattan on that dark Sunday afternoon in December did not seem to mind.

title: A McCain Commercial Turns Romneys Words Against Him
description: Senator John McCains presidential campaign introduced a new Web video on Tuesday that portrays his Republican rival Mitt Romney as dismissive of the need for foreign policy experience in a dangerous world, where war and terrorism continue to pose threats to American security.

title: Gaza Is Tense as It Tallies Casualties
description: GAZA  Gaza remained tense on Tuesday after a night of clashes between Hamas and Fatah gunmen.

title: Old MacDonald Had a Quail
description: SHORT of hayrides from the curb to the coat check, theres not a whole lot in the way of farmhouse allusions that the new restaurant Irving Mill doesnt try.

title: In His Own Words
description: Mike Huckabee, a former Republican governor of Arkansas, speaking Tuesday at an Elks Lodge in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, as recorded and transcribed by The New York Times.

title: Guitar x Four = Flexible Sound to Fill a Hall
description: Andrs Segovia once described the guitar as an orchestra seen through a reversed telescope, a metaphor suggesting that his instruments comparatively small voice and subtle range of timbres offset the chordal and contrapuntal freedom it offers. In a New Years Eve concert at the 92nd Street Y, the Los Angeles Guitar Quartet took Segovias observation to heart and tested a proposition of its own: that an ensemble of four guitars magnifies both sides of the equation, yielding far greater independence of movement and a louder sound as well.

title: Let the Oven Do All the Work
description: IF you buy a big pork shoulder and take your time, as you should, the classic Puerto Rican pork roast called pernil can take you nearly all day. The last time I roasted a large one it was in the oven for seven hours.

title: Calendar
description: Of Guiltless Pleasures

title: Designers Rainbow Brightens Iranian Womens Look
description: TEHRAN  For many of the chic and well-to-do here in the capital of Iran, a country where women are required by law to conceal the shapes of their bodies, Simin Ghodstinats designs provide a sort of middle way. Her clothes are elegant, luxurious and expensive  all while staying well within the religious authorities strictly enforced boundaries of propriety.

title: Taking the Temperature of Dinner
description: THE most important step in mastering heat is to get into the habit of using a thermometer to keep track of temperature  that of the food itself, and of the surface or space in which it is cooked or stored.

title: 30 Dead in Baghdads Worst Attack in Months
description: BAGHDAD  Thirty people were killed Tuesday when a suicide bomber strode into a gathering of mourners at a home in eastern Baghdad and detonated an explosives-packed vest, the Interior Ministry said. It was the most brazen and deadly attack in the capital in months.

title: Police Kill Maryland Inmate After He Escapes
description: A 45-year-old prisoner who escaped from a hospital in Maryland, where he overpowered a guard, stole a pair of guns and carjacked a motorist, was fatally shot by the police on Wednesday afternoon. The inmate, identified as Kelvin Poke, 45, was killed by police officers when they caught up with him in a cemetery on Suitland Road, outside of Washington. Henry Tippett, a spokesman for the Prince Georges County police, said Mr. Poke was pronounced dead at Prince Georges Hospital Center after an exchange of gunfire with police that took place around 3 p.m. He said that officers who were pursuing the escaped prisoner spotted a white Ford Explorer with two flat tires and followed the vehicle into the cemetery.

title: Passing Is Fancy; Palmer Is Unhappy
description: The rise of the passing game has been an N.F.L. trend for years, but it reached new heights this season with seven quarterbacks topping 4,000 yards. That is as many as the previous two seasons combined.

title: Losing an Edge, Japanese Envy Indias Schools
description: MITAKA, Japan  Japan is suffering a crisis of confidence these days about its ability to compete with its emerging Asian rivals, China and India. But even in this fad-obsessed nation, one result was never expected: a growing craze for Indian education.

title: Hotels Prime Audience: Sitting in a Meeting, Dreaming of the Greens
description: THE Crowne Plaza Hotels & Resorts chain, which caters squarely to business travelers, has signed up a celebrity spokesman whose specialty is near and dear to the guests hearts: golf.

title: Guided by Beckett From the Grave
description: The director Deborah Warner had seen her share of boring productions of Samuel Becketts Happy Days, and during bleak winter days at the end of 2006, she became worried that she was making one herself. Like Winnie, the chattering protagonist of this 1961 drama, who is gradually being buried alive, Ms. Warner, along with her longtime collaborator, the actress Fiona Shaw, felt stuck.

title: In Winds of Winter, Midair Park Takes Shape
description: The sleek, computer-driven architectural previews of New Yorks first midair park, the High Line, depict pedestrians navigating a public promenade that is on track to be celebrated next fall. Like space-age schematics, they offer a futuristic refuge: a pristine ribbon of green providing exquisite views of Manhattan.

title: Fire Marshals Shooting Death on Staten Island Leaves Family Torn and Puzzled
description: Christmas lights lined Tarring Street on Staten Island, but one spot on the block stayed dark as a hole. It was as if the same pistol that killed its owner, Douglas Mercereau, took the life of his house, too, its time of death suggested by the Happy Thanksgiving sign in the front window.

title: Burglary Suspect Dies
description: A burglary suspect in the Bronx died on Tuesday before officers were able to bring him to a precinct station and file charges, the police said.

title: Giants Reese Deserves Credit, Too
description: During his 13-year run with the Giants, Jerry Reese has watched and listened.

title: Knicks Starting Lineup Remains in Limbo
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Knicks fans may see their splintered team in full Wednesday night at Madison Square Garden. Then again, maybe they wont. From game to game, the makeup of the team has become anybodys guess.

title: F.B.I. Brings a Fresh Set of Eyes to a 71 Plane Hijacking Mystery
description: CHICAGO  It is considered one of the great unsolved mysteries of American crime: how a seemingly quiet man in his mid-40s hijacked an airliner somewhere between Seattle and Reno in November 1971, then parachuted in his loafers and trench coat, making off with $200,000 in cash.

title: A Little Help in the Big City
description: New York can be a very difficult place to live on a fixed income. In recent years, 80-year-old Jack Silberman watched helplessly as his everyday expenses inched up above what he could afford.

title: Rock Is Back. Give Him a Cookie.
description: Thats right, New Years Eve, Chris Rock said. Im a little nervous. I havent done this in a while. These were just about the first words he spoke all night, and this was definitely the last time he sounded hesitant.

title: A Film Year Full of Escapism, Flat in Attendance
description: LOS ANGELES  Despite a modest increase in 2007 box office receipts, moviedom is trudging into January with a droop in its shoulders.

title: U.S. Diplomat and Driver Are Shot Dead in Sudan
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  An American diplomat in Sudan and his driver were shot to death early Tuesday as they were coming home from a New Years Eve party in Khartoum, the capital.

title: Missouri Wins With Ease, but Says It Deserved Better
description: DALLAS  When Missouri tailback Tony Temple scored his last touchdown, which set Cotton Bowl records for rushing yards and rushing touchdowns, two teammates carried him off the field.

title: Whats Your Consumption Factor?
description: Los Angeles

title: A Second Girl Is Hit by Stray Gunfire
description: For the second time in less than 12 hours, a young girl in New York City was shot by stray gunfire. And like the girl in the first case, the second victim escaped with a nonfatal wound and was expected to make a full recovery, a hospital administrator said.

title: Indias Exports Surge Before an Expected Slowdown
description: Indias exports of manufactured goods, including gems and fuel products, rose in November as companies completed orders and hedged to cope with the rupees appreciation.

title: Saying Race Is No Barrier, Obama Still Courts Blacks
description: WATERLOO, Iowa  At a recent focus group of black voters in South Carolina, strategists for Senator Barack Obama presented a videotape of a speech he delivered at the Jefferson Jackson Dinner in Iowa, featuring images of an overwhelmingly white audience applauding earnestly.

title: Neediest Cases Fund-Raising Totals
description: Previously recorded: $4,158,143

title: Pakistan Vote Delayed to February
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  Parliamentary elections scheduled for Jan. 8 have been postponed by the government until February, the secretary of the Election Commission said Tuesday.

title: A More Modest Crowd in Albany, With Plenty of Advice for Spitzer
description: ALBANY  Last year, they came by the thousands, most of them Democrats eager to shake the hand of their bold, triumphant, newly elected leader. This year, they came in the hundreds, and like caring relatives seemed intent on offering Eliot Spitzer their advice as well as their adulation.

title: In the Land of Many Ifs
description: For months, the American economy has been assailed by a wave of troubling news, from plunging housing prices to the soaring cost of oil, provoking gloomy talk of a possible recession. Yet so far the economy has found a way to shrug it all off and keep growing.

title: Bickering and Negative Ads in Countdown to Caucuses
description: DES MOINES  On a bitterly cold New Years Day two days before the Iowa caucuses, the leading Democratic presidential candidates drew some of their largest crowds of this Iowa campaign season, while the top Republican contenders continued to ratchet up their attacks on one other.

title: U.S.C. Cuts the Profile of a Title Contender
description: PASADENA, Calif.  When it was over at the Rose Bowl, when John David Booty had finished orchestrating a 49-17 victory for Southern California as thorough as it was majestic, he climbed a ladder in the end zone, grabbed the sword from the universitys mascot and conducted the Trojans band in a rousing version of Conquest, the throbbing U.S.C. victory march.

title: Customers, Not Brokers, Profited in an Odd 2007
description: The brokers customers did reasonably well. The brokers did not.

title: In London, a Compact but Elegant Flat
description: LONDON

title: The Invisible Ingredient in Every Kitchen
description: OF all the ingredients in the kitchen, the most common is also the most mysterious.

title: Stocks Drop on Manufacturing Report
description: Wall Streets hopes for a bullish start to the year faded on Wednesday after oil prices surged to the symbolic $100 mark and manufacturing activity unexpectedly shrank in December, reviving fears of an impending recession.

title: The Wolverines Ride Emotion, and Hennes Arm, to Victory
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Before Michigan played Florida in the Capital One Bowl in the final game of Coach Lloyd Carrs career Tuesday, he addressed his team with tears in his eyes and emotion in his voice, his players said.

title: For Start-Up, Its a Tweak Here, an Experiment There
description: This is the third in a series of three articles about start-ups and their founders hopes for the year ahead. The first appeared Dec. 13 and the second on Dec. 19. This column will return to all three after six months, and again after one year, to compare their achievements with their original goals.

title: Georgia Runs Over Hawaii in Sugar Bowl, 41-10
description: NEW ORLEANS  On Georgias first possession of the Sugar Bowl, Bulldogs tailback Knowshon Moreno danced 17 yards, untouched, into the end zone. He celebrated by blowing a kiss to Georgia fans.

title: North Korea Calls for End to Hostile U.S. Policies
description: SEOUL, South Korea  An editorial in North Koreas three major state-run newspapers urged the United States on Tuesday to abandon its hostile policies and proposed closer economic ties with South Korea, which will soon inaugurate a new president.

title: Candidates Play to Audiences on the Road in Iowa
