description: DES MOINES  As Mitt Romney, Fred D. Thompson and Mike Huckabee hit points all over Iowa in a closing flurry before Thursdays caucuses, it can seem as if they are campaigning in three entirely different worlds.

title: Eased Rules on Tech Sales to China Questioned
description: WASHINGTON  Six months ago, the Bush administration quietly eased some restrictions on the export of politically delicate technologies to China. The new approach was intended to help American companies increase sales of high-tech equipment to China despite tight curbs on sharing technology that might have military applications.

title: Big Makeovers for Office Buildings Outside of Midtown
description: Extreme makeovers provide many of the plotlines for reality television, from Queer Eye for the Straight Guy to The Biggest Loser. The same could also be said for some recent Manhattan real estate deals, where developers have bought office buildings with the intention of pouring millions of dollars into fixing them up.

title: Man Fatally Shot by Police in Brooklyn
description: Police officers shot and killed an armed man in Brooklyn on Tuesday night during a narcotics investigation, the police said.

title: Iowa Is Uncertain as Out-of-State Students Return
description: DES MOINES  One of the $64,000-questions about Thursdays Iowa caucuses is how much students from out of state will influence the outcome.

title: Got a Night Job? Then No Caucus for You
description: DES MOINES  Jason Huffman has lived in Iowa his whole life. Lately he has been watching presidential debates on the Internet, discussing what he sees with friends and relatives. But when fellow Iowans choose among presidential candidates on Thursday night, he will not be able to vote, because he is serving with the National Guard in western Afghanistan.

title: Stonewalled by the C.I.A.
description: Washington

title: Bridging Cultures, and Taking Arabic to Iowa
description: KALONA, Iowa

title: Edwards Calls for Quick End to Iraq Training
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa  John Edwards says that if elected president he would withdraw the American troops who are training the Iraqi army and police as part of a broader plan to remove virtually all American forces within 10 months.

title: Drowning in Special-Interest Money
description: Special-interest money in politics is said to be like water  blocking its flow in one direction only channels it to another. In this years presidential election, the flow is turning into a flood.

title: Edwards on the Economy
description: John Edwards is running a notably more populist campaign than either Hillary Clinton or Barack Obama. In several ways, Mr. Edwards is more open to using the government to try to help the middle class - and less trusting of the free market.

title: A Divide as Wolves Rebound in a Changing West
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo.  Sheltered for many years by federal species protection law, the gray wolves of the West are about to step out onto the high wire of life in the real world, when their status as endangered animals formally comes to an end early this year.

title: An Intellectual Insider, Forever on the Outside
description: I like this guy because he is excited, Jack Kerouac wrote in his diary after an encounter with Alfred Kazin on the streets of New York in the late 1940s. He stumbles about, chatting away, almost getting run over by trucks, eager, stuttering, proud, a little piqued at this world, which makes him cast furtive looks out of the corner of his eye.

title: Democrats: More Than Health Care
description: Perhaps you have heard that Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama have come up with different health care plans. Hers would require every American to own health insurance. His would not.

title: Winter Wonderland for Crosby and N.H.L.
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y.  With more than 71,000 fans filling a football stadium that at times resembled a snow globe, the N.H.L. had a storybook setting for its outdoor game Tuesday between the Buffalo Sabres and the Pittsburgh Penguins. And with the winning goal coming off the stick of the Penguins star Sidney Crosby in a shootout, the league could not have scripted a more satisfying ending.

title: Saudis Confirm Detention of Blogger
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  An outspoken Saudi blogger is being held for purposes of interrogation, the Saudi Interior Ministry confirmed Tuesday.

title: Out of the Barn and Into the Snifter
description: Roquefort, France

title: Swiss Army, Heres Your Knife
description: AT a cooking lesson with Su-Mei Yu, a Thai chef and cookbook author, I was handed a large lightweight Chinese cleaver and told I was to do all my slicing, dicing and shredding with it.

title: Making the Scallops Happy
description: A PAN roast at the Oyster Bar, like cheesecake at Juniors and frozen hot chocolate at Serendipity 3, is one of those dishes New Yorkers love to champion, even if we havent tasted it in decades.

title: Deal to Buy Mortgage Company Collapses
description: In another sign that troubles within the mortgage industry will continue into 2008, one of the largest originators of residential home loans announced Tuesday that it is scrapping a planned $1.8 billion sale, because banks had failed to agree to finance the transaction.

title: John Lennons Death Revisited Through the Words of His Killer
description: I was nobody until I killed the biggest somebody on earth.

title: In Their Own Words
description: Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr., Democrat of Delaware, speaking Tuesday at the Raccoon River Brewing Company in Des Moines, as recorded and transcribed by The New York Times.

title: Leonard B. Meyer, Scholar of Musics Meaning, Is Dead at 89
description: Leonard B. Meyer, a pioneering musicologist whose 1956 book, Emotion and Meaning in Music, remains one of the most significant scholarly works in the field of music cognition, died on Sunday at his home in Manhattan. He was 89.

title: Viewers of All Sizes Decide Who Walks the Catwalk
description: It doesnt count as a global crisis, but the ranks of the worlds supermodels are depleted. Kate Moss is aging, and Gisele Bndchen draws more attention for whom shes dating than whom shes wearing. Todays Twiggy-in-the-making, Agyness Deyn, is a quirky platinum pixie, more adorable than memorable. Luckily, models are a renewable resource, and Bravos new show, Make Me a Supermodel, is asking novices to fill the void.

title: If Elected: The Candidates on Foreign Policy
description: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton foresees a remaining military as well as political mission in Iraq, and says that if elected president, she would keep a reduced military force there to fight Al Qaeda, deter Iranian aggression, protect the Kurds and possibly support the Iraqi military.

title: Council Plans Session on Deutsche Bank Fire
description: The City Council plans an extensive hearing next week on the blaze at the former Deutsche Bank building near ground zero that led to the deaths of two firefighters.

title: Tonights Menu: Chestnuts and Guilty Pleasures
description: No one, except the musicians, had to work hard at Avery Fisher Hall on New Years Eve. Profundity, nobility and cosmic suffering had the evening off. Joshua Bell played his violin; Lorin Maazel conducted his New York Philharmonic. A big crowd dotted with the dressed-up and the overdressed sat back and sang along inside their heads with old favorites.

title: Lottery Numbers
Weekly Wrap: Palmers Numbers Are Up, but His Mood Is Down
description: Andrew Das, Benjamin Hoffman, Naila-Jean Meyers, John Woods and Toni Monkovic contributed to this notebook.

title: The Fans Are Robbed
description: New Orleans  Obviously, this Sugar Bowl has turned into a gigantic dud.

title: Undercover
description: Contemporary artist Jorge Macchi was born in Buenos Aires in 1963. His work has been featured in solo exhibitions at the University of Essex in England, Recoleta Cultural Center in Buenos Aires and the Museum of Contemporary Art of Antwerp. His latest exhibition, The Anatomy of Melancholy, is on view at the Blanton Museum of Art at The University of Texas at Austin through March 16, 2008.

title: Devotion, Thy Name Is Noone
description: The Patriots honored their fan of the year before Christmas, and while these awards are by their nature subjective, it would be hard to argue with this years choice.

title: Feds Share Coupons to Help TV Transition
description: Millions of $40 government coupons become available Tuesday to help low-tech television owners buy special converter boxes for older TVs that might not work after the Feb. 18, 2009 switch to digital broadcasting, the Associated Press reports.

title: Gawker Media Gets Strung Out on Sci-Fi
description: Online blogomerate Gawker Media is best known for outsider snark-fests like New Yorks Gawker and Washington D.C.s Wonkette . But the company minors in geekier fare like gadget site Gizmodo, game blog Kotaku and Lifehacker, a productivity site. To that part of its portfolio, Nick Dentons blog empire is now adding IO9, a site whose motto proclaims that it is strung out on science fiction.

title: A Ramble in Olmsted Parks
description: Images from the coming exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Teacher Burnout? Blame the Parents
description: The stress of teaching is often blamed on rowdy students and unrealistic expectations from school officials. But new research suggests that parents may be the real culprit in teacher burnout.

title: $450,000 Homes
description: Properties on the market in Vermont, Montana and California.

title: Food Stuff
description: A Block of Hot Chocolate? Dunk, Melt, Stir, Sip

title: Hes Back!
description: It takes only five seconds, but this clip, which Laugh Lines used for Halloween, helped a humble but scary-looking creature reach critical critter mass in 2007. It made numerous top viral video lists, including here, here and here:

title: Take My Wife
description: One of Chris Rocks best lines at his New Years Eve show at Madison Square Garden came while discussing Hillary Clintons presidential campaign. He mocked the notion that marriage confers professional expertise. Ive been with my wife for 10 years now, he said. If she got onstage right now, yall wouldnt laugh at all. Read more

title: Australian Mall Owner Seeks Buyers
description: The Centro Properties Group, facing a mid-February deadline to refinance 3.9 billion Australian dollars ($3.4 billion) of debt, said Wednesday it is seeking buyers for the company.

title: Legg Mason Puts Up $1.1 Billion to Bail Out Funds
description: Legg Mason said Friday that it would put up $1.1 billion in cash and guarantees to bail out two of its money market funds that were coming under pressure from their asset-backed commercial paper investments, in the latest of such bailouts triggered by the credit crisis.

title: Drake Suspends Withdrawals From $3 Billion Fund
description: Drake Management suspended most redemptions from its largest hedge fund after losing 23.7 percent through November, Bloomberg News reported, citing a letter sent to investors of the New York-based firm.

title: Kerkorian Takes Stake in Delta Petroleum
description: A month after he was spurned by Tesoro, billionaire investor Kirk Kerkorian has found another energy company more friendly to his acquisitive advances.

title: Vietnamese Brewer to Tap Public Markets
description: The Saigon Beer Alcohol Beverage Corporation, Vietnams largest brewer, plans to raise at least $557 million by selling 20 percent of its shares in an initial public offering late this month.

title: MF Global Fined Over Hedge Fund Losses
description: The Commodities Futures Trading Commission formally fined MF Global, a New York-listed futures broker spun off this year by the Man Group, for allegedly helping to conceal losses at a clients hedge fund, bringing the companys total legal bill for the case to $77 million.

title: MC Hammer to Launch Online Video Site
description: MC Hammer hasnt topped the music charts since the early 1990s, but the former rap star says he has another hit in him  only this time around hell produce it as a Silicon Valley entrepreneur.

title: SpiralFrog Downloads $2 Million
description: A digital music start-up, SpiralFrog, said Friday that it had raised $2 million from private investors, bringing the total investment to date to $13 million as it expands its offerings of free, downloadable tracks.

title: Former H&R Block Chief Gets $2.5 Million Severance
description: H&R Block disclosed that its former chairman and chief executive, Mark A. Ernst, will receive a $2.55 million cash severance payment. Block, which provides tax, accounting and other financial services, said in a filing Monday with the Securities and Exchange Commission that Mr. Ernst, who stepped down last month, also resigned from the companys board Friday.

title: OMX Board Backs Bid from Borse Dubai
description: OMX, the Nordic and Baltic exchange owner, said Wednesday that its board had unanimously recommended a takeover bid by Borse Dubai, which had teamed up with Nasdaq to purchase the company.

title: Fortissimo Snaps Up Magic Software Unit
description: Magic Software Enterprises, a maker of tools for business software development and integration, said it sold its Advanced Answers on Demand subsidiary to a private equity firm, Fortissimo Capital, for $17 million. The agreement calls for payment in two installments with the last coming by the end of January.

title: Indias Reliance Energy Prepares $3 Billion Offering
description: Reliance Power of India is set to launch an initial public offering to raise up to $2.97 billion in the countrys biggest I.P.O., Reuters reported. The company will issue 260 million shares at an indicated price band of 405 to 450 rupees ($10.30 to $11.40) each, the report said.

title: Santander Said to Have Held Talks for British Lender
description: Grupo Santander, the owner of Abbey National, was recently in talks to buy another mortgage lender in Britain but negotiations stumbled on price and came to nothing, according to The Financial Times.

title: 3i to Buy a British Laser Treatment Firm
description: 3i, a publicly traded private equity firm in Britain, has agreed to buy Ultralase, a British laser eye treatment firm, for 174.5 million pounds ($347.8 million) from Corporacion Dermoestetica of Spain.

title: AT&T Said to Consider Stake in Telekom Malaysia
description: AT&T wants to buy an unspecified stake in the mobile arm of state-controlled phone firm Telekom Malaysia , a Malaysian newspaper reported on Wednesday.

title: Ghosts of Subprime Past May Continue to Haunt
description: The expression out with the old and in with the new may not mean much to investment banks in this new year, as many industry observers are predicting that Wall Streets subprime-related pain will extend well into 2008.

title: Warren Buffett Opens His Wallet
description: Warren E. Buffett is apparently in no mood to quit.

title: Hedge Fund Raises Stake in Northern Rock
description: RAB Capital, the second largest shareholder of Northern Rock, the troubled British lender, has bought shares in the company for the second time in two days, raising its stake to 7.5 percent ahead of a January shareholder meeting, according to a filing Friday.

title: Customers, Not Brokers, Profited in an Odd 2007
description: The brokers customers did reasonably well. The brokers did not.

title: Buffett May Not Testify in General Re Case
description: The billionaire Warren E. Buffett, who is on the prosecution witness list in the criminal trial of Ronald E. Ferguson, former chief executive of General Reinsurance Corporation, may not be called to testify, the government said in court filings Monday.

title: Deal for Mortgage Lender PHH Collapses
description: In another sign that troubles within the mortgage industry will continue into 2008, one of the largest originators of residential home loans announced Tuesday that it is scrapping a planned $1.8 billion sale, because banks had failed to agree to finance the transaction.

title: Hedge Funds Said to Beat Market in Tough Year
description: The hedge fund industry remains on course to beat stock market returns in 2007, The Financial Times said, citing data from Chicago-based Hedge Fund Research.

title: Buyout Shops Exit From Freedom Is Delayed
description: The sale of minority stakes held by the Blackstone Group and Providence Equity Partners in Freedom Communications, a newspaper group, has been halted because banks have balked at financing the deal because of the credit crisis and a poor outlook for print media.

title: Merrill Said to Be in Fresh Talks for Funding
description: Merrill Lynch, which a little more than a week ago announced that it would sell a $6.2 billion stake to the Singapore government and a mutual fund manager, is reportedly in fresh talks with Chinese and Middle Eastern sovereign wealth funds to slice off another piece of itself in return for much-needed cash.

title: Citi and Merrill Top Underwriting League Tables
description: Ousting their chief executives and multi-billion dollar write-offs werent the only thing that Citigroup and Merrill Lynch had in common in 2007. The two banks were the worlds top underwriters of stocks and bonds, measured by volume and reported fees, despite being at the epicenter of the global credit crisis.

title: Nyah Nyah Nyah Nyah Nyah Nyah
description: The late-night talk shows are back starting tonight, but your jokes arent going away (keep sending them via the comment link below). Fresh reader comedy:

title: The Early Word: The Independent Turnout Factor
description: As we cross the 24-hour countdown to the Iowa caucuses later today, one of the biggest unknowns is just how significant voter turnout will be among independents and first-time caucus-goers.

title: Why H.I.V. Cases Are Rising Among Young Gay Men
description: Sarah Kershaw, who covers public health in New York City, examines the reasons by this phenomenon: The number of new H.I.V. infections in men under 30 who have sex with men has increased sharply in the city in the last five years, particularly among blacks and Hispanics, even as AIDS deaths and overall H.I.V. infection rates in the city have steadily declined.

title: Winners and Losers in a Year of Deal-Making
description: For Wall Streets deal-makers, 2007 was like two years in one: First it boomed, then the bottom fell out. In our annual closing dinner column, DealBook toasted  and roasted  some of the years biggest names, including Rupert Murdoch, Lloyd Blankfein, Nelson Peltz and more.

title: An Unlikely Celebrity Sex Tape: Malaysian Minister
description: If Malaysias Minister of Health, Chua Soi Lek, were a lucky man, he might have fended off recent accusations of infidelity the way many others have: by working the he-said/she-said (or he-said/he-said) angle for everything it is worth and hoping that the next news cycle forgets you.

title: FINAL at the WJC: Canada 4-2 Finland
description: Review the play by play of the World Junior Championship quarterfinal match, described as it happened at the CEZ Arena in Pardubice, Czech Republic. Jeff Z. Klein described the action.

title: Iowa Forecast: Caucus Eve
description: Caucus Countdown: One day. One More Day.

title: Promises, Promises
description: Promises, especially those made by presidential candidates, are made to be broken: In U.S. history, I can think of just two presidents (there may be others) who were remarkably good at fulfilling their campaign pledges, writes Joseph Ellis, the Mount Holyoke historian, on the op-ed page of The Los Angeles Times.

title: N.H. Forecast: Are We There Yet?
description: Countdown: 6 days until the primary.

title: Clintons 2-Minute Appeal
description: In her final pitch to Iowans, Hillary Rodham Clinton  rarely breaking eye contact  implores voters to put on your coats and call up a friend and help me change America.

title: U.S. Loses Ground in Law-Firm League Tables
description: Coming off of its fourth year atop the merger advisory league tables, you might think Sullivan & Cromwell would be in a celebratory mood. But as 2007 came to a close, H. Rodgin Cohen, the law firms chairman, acknowledged the honor with a decidedly cautious tone.

title: Jozy Altidore: New Challenges in a New Year
description: Red Bulls forward Jozy Altidore contributes items for The New York Times Goal blog each week. In his latest post, Altidore discusses his goals in 2008, his call-up to the United States national team training camp and more.

title: Racing Along With the Edwards Marathon
description: COUNCIL BLUFFS  It was not yet midnight on John Edwardss all-night Marathon for the Middle Class tour when the unthinkable metaphor happened: the bus broke down.

title: Whos The Man? In Istanbul, its Tarkan
description: Tarkans new CD cover look. Visitors to Istanbul are likely to hear his songs in clubs and cafes.

title: Letterman and Leno Return Tonight
description: Update: 1:14 p.m.: When Jay Leno and Conan OBrien of NBC return to their late-night television homes tonight, their guests and audience members will face picket lines of striking writers.

title: Paying the Cost of Climate Control
description: Peter Barnes, a founder of Working Assets, the fund making socially responsible investments, has long studied various bills and proposals for cutting emissions of carbon dioxide to limit global warming. He sees fatal flaws in every one. So he has come up with a new formula that he says uniquely addresses the most inconvenient truth about climate policy: It will be expensive.

title: African Cup Creates Holes for Teams in Europe
description: There is one topic dominating international soccer headlines during the first few days of the new year: player personnel. The international transfer window is open until Jan. 31 and teams may buy and sell players  permanently or on loan  to compensate for injuries, fortify rosters for Champions League campaigns and make up for the loss of key players during the African Cup of Nations.

title: Wednesday Kickoff: A Fitting End for Carr
description: New Years Day was a special day for Lloyd Carr. Aside from it being his final game as Michigans coach and the Wolverines playing their hearts out in a thrilling victory against Florida, Carr received almost universal plaudits from around the college football world. It must have been a strange feeling for a man who has been routinely second-guessed throughout his career. Bob Wojnowski of the Detroit News brings us inside the Michigan lockerroom after the game and tells us how Carr addressed his team. Not to be outdone, Larry Lage of The Associated Press gives us an inside look at Carrs final days with the team, from meetings to meals. ESPNs Eric Adelson writes that Michigan fans were reminded of the type of offense they are giving up now that Carr is being replaced by Rich Rodriguez.

title: How to Boil a Frog
description: In talking about oil and geopolitics, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton has been slipping in this homespun-sounding analogy as of late.

title: Elections Delayed in Pakistan
description: Pakistan's main opposition parties denounced the decision to postpone parliamentary elections but said they would abide by the ruling.

title: Two-Buck Huck
description: The rap against Mike Huckabee, the Baptist preacher and ex-Arkansas governor now doing for the Republican Party establishment what three-alarm chili does for an afternoon nap, is that hes too inexperienced to be president, too nave  a rube straight out of Dogpatch.

title: Analyst Dampens Time Warner Deal Speculation
description: Wednesday was not just the first trading day of the year. It was also the first working day for Jeffrey Bewkes in his role as the new chief executive of media octopus Time Warner.

title: Betti O
description: At a recent appearance, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton had an opening act.

title: Survival of the Chicest | the Shoehorn
description: I always travel with a shoehorn.

title: Huckabee Will Cross Picket Line to Appear on Leno
description: Former Governor Mike Huckabee of Arkansas today professed his support for the striking television writers union just a few hours before he was expected to board a plane for a taping of the Jay Leno show where he will face a vocal picket line of striking writers.

title: Manhattan Gets a New District Attorney, but Only on TV
description: The 18th season of NBCs Law & Order opens tonight with the actor Sam Waterston in a new role, that of Manhattan district attorney. Mr. Waterstons character will be the fourth Manhattan district attorney in the history of the series, which started in 1990 (not counting a pilot episode shot in 1988). But during that time, there has been only one real Manhattan district attorney: Robert M. Morgenthau, elected in 1974.

title: Venture Investors Leap Through I.P.O. Window
description: Giving money to start-ups is easy. Getting it back, with profits: Thats the tough part of being a venture capitalist.

title: CNN Unplugged (Or at Least, Unfiltered)
description: On New Years Day, CNN selected some unusual programming: unedited speeches by the presidential candidates.

title: Promising Debut for Biggest Loser
description: NBCs latest edition of The Biggest Loser  this time, featuring dieting couples who will be judged by their combined weight loss  got off to a solid start in the ratings on Tuesday, as 10.4 million viewers tuned in from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m. for the shows debut, according to Nielsens overnight estimates. Among adults 18 to 49, the episode fared better than any of the four previous premieres of the series, boosting NBC to a second-place finish for the night.

title: New Questions for a New Year
description: While I was on vacation, three of my Silicon Valley colleagues posted about the questions they meant to ask in 2007 and didnt. Now that Im back, I figured Id add my list of what I am most curious about for 2008.

title: The Other Horse Race
description: The Bagger just came back from vacation and heard there was some other contest besides the Oscars going on. Always in search of that elusive Oscar angle, he discovered that Michael Moore, whose Sicko is likely to be nominated for best doc, is switching horses. Anne Thompson of Variety details a pitch from the reflexively liberal director on behalf of the one Democrat he feels can make a difference  whose name is not Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: Clintons Run-Up to the Caucus
description: ABOARD THE CLINTON PRESS BUS  The politico who runs Hillary Rodham Clintons campaign in Iowa, Teresa Vilmain, gave reporters a rundown Wednesday morning of her teams run-up to the presidential caucuses Thursday night.

title: Matchup for the Fiesta Bowl
description: Fiesta Bowl8 P.M., No. 9 West Virginia (10-2) vs. No. 4 Oklahoma (11-2), Glendale, Ariz., FOX

title: Leno, OBrien Will Face Pickets
description: When Jay Leno and Conan OBrien of NBC return to their late-night television homes tonight, their guests and audience members will face picket lines of striking writers.

title: Debatable Democracy
description: On my flight back to Des Moines today, I read an interesting piece by my colleagues Michael Falcone and Sarah Wheaton about the upcoming debates in New Hampshire. It seems that both Fox and ABC have taken it upon themselves to winnow the field of candidates by excluding those who dont seem viable at this point. Fox, for instance, is shutting out Ron Paul, despite his having reached fourth place in some recent New Hampshire polls and his having spent a truckload of money on ads in the state. (I swear, you cant drive three miles in New Hampshire without hearing Ron Paul on the radio; hes more overplayed than Fergie, albeit easier to listen to.) ABC has decided that if you dont finish in the top four in Iowa, and you dont reach five percent in New Hampshire or national polls, then youre just cluttering up the stage and should watch at home like everyone else.

title: Think You Know Your Body? Heres a Test
description: Talking to my sister the other day about an ache in her side, I dragged out an anatomy book to try to figure out exactly what body parts were in the vicinity of her pain. We never figured it out and the pain went away, but it did make me realize I needed a better anatomy book.

title: A Slowing Economy?
description: Todays economic statistics indicate that the fourth quarter GDP figure is likely to be respectable, as were the last two quarters. Those figures have made the economic naysayers  myself included  look a little foolish, and that trend seems set to continue.

title: Video: The Divine Ms. O
description: IOWA CITY, Iowa  Life on the campaign trail invariably involves a lot of waiting. Waiting for the candidate to arrive and waiting for the event to begin. Usually with Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, a very familiar soundtrack of KT Tunstall and Celine Dion fills the time.

title: Clinton on the Bus
description: ABOARD THE CLINTON PRESS BUS  Hillary Rodham Clinton just hopped on board the bus carrying the reporters who cover her campaign, and dispensed hot coffee, bagels, and good wishes to those who had been following her since she entered the presidential race in mid-January 2007.

title: FINAL at the WJC: Russia 4, Czech 1
description: Review the play by play of the World Junior Championship quarterfinal match, described as it happened at the CEZ Arena in Pardubice, Czech Republic. Lew Serviss, watching the tube at the Slap Shot bureau in Tucson, Ariz., described the action.

title: Is Washington Hung Up on 3Com Deal?
description: Government-run funds from Asia and the Mideast have been scooping up billion-dollar stakes in Wall Street firms  with hardly a peep from politicians. But it is a relatively small, private investment in 3Com, the telecommunications equipment company, that seems to be striking a nerve in Washington.

title: For the Moment | Loden Dager Shoots Models, Scores Award
description: This weeks guest bloggers are Loden Dager, a mens wear collective based in New York City that launched in the Fall of 2006. Its members, pictured, are: Melissa Vail, Matthew Sandager, Oliver Helden, Paul Marlow, and Alex Galan. This week Loden Dager writes from the road as they journey South in search of inspiration. Today the group reveals something to celebrate: it has won the Ecco Domani Fashion Foundation award for new talent. (Read yesterdays blog entry written by Loden Dager and a profile of Alex Galan here.)

title: Giuliani Calls for Troop Surge in Afghanistan
description: WOLFEBORO, N.H.  Rudolph W. Giuliani did something highly unusual here Wednesday: he unveiled a new policy proposal in a speech, something he has not done in months of recent campaigning.

title: The Grim Facts About Lethal Injection
description: Supreme Court arguments used to be secretive things. The Internet has changed that. Important cases now often have their own Websites. They offer a wealth of information, much of it for lawyers, but a lot for non-lawyers as well.

title: The Final Stretch in Iowa
description: The presidential candidates fanned out across the state on the final day before the presidential caucuses.

title: The Great Plane Robbery and Other Sordid Tales
description: When flight attendants get together for drinks, inevitably the conversation turns skyward. We share details about the deranged man who sprinted up the aisle of an Airbus, slapping passengers heads along the way (true story). We gossip about the shameless couple that had sex in a main-cabin seat (I saw them with my own eyes), the freaked-out-flier who tried to open the emergency exit at 15,000 feet (I grabbed him with my own hands), the hapless pilot who stepped into a dark unlocked lavatory and got his foot caught in a screaming womans panties. (The captain looked me straight in the eye and recounted his embarrassing experience.)

title: Pakistan: A View From the D.J. Booth
description: Munizeh Sanai, host of "The Rush Hour" in Karachi, Pakistan, discusses the country's unrest.

title: Tell Us About Your Commute
description: Every day during January, Billie Cohen is documenting a different commute for NYTimes.com/realestate, with additional details and reader comments here on City Room. Here is a listing of all the articles in the Next Stop series.

title: Taking Race Out of the Race
description: As I noted earlier this week, some of Barack Obamas comments have been inciting fury among labor leaders and Democrats online, especially now thats hes increasingly taking aim at John Edwards, whose class-warrior message resonates with the partys hyper-partisans. The latest sniping on the blogs centered Mr. Obamas suggestion that Democrats needed to nominate someone whom half the country wouldnt immediately reject, which, according to Mr. Obama, is what they did in 2000 and again in 2004. This comment wasnt significantly different from the electability argument that most of the Democrats have made at one time or another, but Mr. Obamas specific reference to Al Gore and John Kerry was enough to renew dubious allegations that Mr. Obama was, once again, sounding more like a Republican than a Democrat.

title: Local Gyms Outpace the National Chains
description: If your New Years resolution includes going back to the gym, you may be happier at a local club than a national chain, according to a new survey by Consumer Reports.

title: A Roundhouse Kick for Huckabee
description: Mitt Romneys latest Web ad, probably too goofy for TV, uses Chuck Norriss endorsement of Mike Huckabee against the former Arkansas governor.

title: Cabs Flower Power Heads to the Big Easy From the Big Apple
description: As of this week, the citys flower taxi art project is officially over. The colorful decals were supposed to be removed from yellow cabs by the new year, though word is that there are some die-hard holdouts.

title: 5 OClock News Back On WNBC
description: WNBC has decided there is a reason to be live at five, after all.

title: French Kiss | Welcome, Marion Cotillard
description: A few minutes ago we hung some new wallpaper on the home page of T Online. You may recognize the actress Marion Cotillard from her appearance on the cover of Ts Fashion & Beauty Winter 2007. She also appears in the film La Vie en Rose playing Edith Piaf, the French singer. Were hoping youll be tempted to read Lynn Hirschbergs profile of Cotillard, or, if youre more of a pictures person, click the images only tab and youll get a slide show of the Raymond Meier photo shoot of Cotillard. (We wont tell Lynn if thats what you choose.) And dont miss the chance to take a few seconds to watch our exclusive Screen Test video interview with the Oscar-worthy actress.

title: Former S.C. Governor Endorses Obama
description: CORALVILLE, Iowa  Jim Hodges, a former governor of South Carolina who supported Wesley Clark in the 2004 primaries, announced this afternoon that he will endorse Senator Barack Obama.

title: Vilsack Says Clinton Has Succeeded in Iowa
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa  After Hillary Rodham Clintons speech here just now, I caught up with her best-known supporter in Iowa, former Gov. Tom Vilsack, a co-chairman of her national campaign.

title: Learning Architecture
description: Students at Cooper Union in the East Village are getting a chance to study construction firsthand.

title: Teenage Smoking Rate Drops to 8.5 Percent
description: The prevalence of smoking among New York City teenagers has continued to fall, continuing a trend that began more than a decade ago, according to figures released by the city government today.

title: The Return of the Blogtalk
description: What were reading elsewhere

title: Assassination by Laser in Pakistan? Probably Not.
description: New questions on the killing of Benazir Bhutto seem to arise every day, and today is no exception. If the sunroof-latch theory advanced and later retracted by the Pakistani interior ministry didnt drop your jaw, this bit of news should:

title: The Great Enigma Videos of 2007
description: I dont like it when people say, l really dug your message, man. Or: l really dug your play, man. I cried. You know? I like it when people come up to me the next day, or a week later, and they say: I saw your play. What happened? Jeff Slater (Bill Murray), Tootsie

title: Roger Clemens Gets a Trailer-Trashing
description: Were you out in the lobby getting Raisinettes? Here is I Am Clemens, a holiday movie preview from Super Deluxe you probably missed:

title: Inside, Fans Line Up For Late Night; Outside, Writers (Quietly) Picket
description: The Writers Guild of America mounted a small line of picketers outside an entrance to Rockefeller Center Wednesday afternoon as audience members of Late Night with Conan OBrien waited inside.

title: Bloomberg, Undeclared, Comments About the Declared
description: As he gears up to attend a conference at the University of Oklahoma next week that has been widely seen as a potential launching pad for a third-party presidential campaign, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg took several minutes out of a news conference about a sharp decline in teenage smoking rates to sound as if he is already running.He offered one of his auto-pilot denials of interest (I am not a candidate), then tossed off one of his broadest critiques yet of the declared field just as the voting is finally about to get under way in Iowa, saying that none of the candidates had sufficiently explained how he or she would solve pressing domestic and international issues.

title: $138 Oil  Good or Bad? (updated from $100)
description: [UPDATE, 6/6, 3:30 p.m.:] Here we go again, again. Remember the good (or bad) old days when oil was just $100 a barrel? Now Jad Mouawad charts the latest oil price spike, triggered in part by a rumor related to Iran. Already its clear gasoline prices have, in fact, started to change consumer behavior, blunting sales even of hybrid SUVs and causing a remarkable drop in vehicle miles driven in March (the latest month with statistics). So the question below remains: Are high oil prices good or bad for the environment?[UPDATED 2/26, 6:30 p.m: Here we go again. My friend Jad Mouawad tonight explores the implications of oil topping $100 a barrel  in an ailing economy and gasoline projected to head toward $4 a gallon. Theres some movement toward more efficient cars, if you can call GMs announcement of an SUV that gets 21 miles per gallon movement. Please read below if you havent before. And weigh in if you see high oil prices as good, bad, or indifferent.]

title: Looking To Next Fight, Romney Hits McCain
description: BETTENDORF, IowaWait, is it the New Hampshire primary tomorrow, not the Iowa Caucus?

title: Bloomberg, Undeclared, Comments About the Declared
description: As he gears up to attend a conference at the University of Oklahoma next week that has been widely seen as a potential launching pad for a third-party presidential campaign, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg took several minutes out of a news conference about a sharp decline in teenage smoking rates to sound as if he is already running.

title: Whither Huckabee?
description: Hucka Hucka Boom Boom: Terry Eastland, the publisher of The Weekly Standard, boards the Huckabus in Iowa to assess the state of the Huckaboom and to ascertain whether it precedes a looming Huckabust. Mike Huckabees economic and cultural populism, Eastland concludes, is at least as important to his appeal as his Christian conservatism.

title: Our Dream Appliances
description: Last night, I did what I do every New Years Day: watch HGTVs debut of its annual Dream House. This years was of particular interest to me because it was built on an island in Florida (Islamorada in the Florida Keys) just like mine.

title: The McCain-Lieberman Duet
description: DERRY, N.H.  Once we unearthed our car from the snow earlier, we made our way to Mary Anns Diner, where Senator John McCain, Senator Joseph I. Lieberman and Mr. McCains wife, Cindy, sat down to lunch with a few diners.

title: A City of Contrasts
description: Travel writer Seth Kugel scours New York City for opposites.

title: Republicans Out-Raised Democrats for National Commitees
description: When it comes to fund-raising, Democrats have outpaced Republicans almost across the board. The lone exception is the Republican National Committee, which reported yesterday that it had raised $83 million for the year, easily topping the Democratic National Committee, which had raised $50.5 million in the first 11 months of 2007.

title: Bad Start, Recession Near?
description: The maven of S.&P. numbers, Howard Silverblatt, points out that today ranks No. 6 among the worst first days of a year for the S.&P. 500. The index fell by 1.4 percent.

title: The Snow Bowl Game, as Seen by The Buffalo News
description: Weve been calling the Sabres-Penguins New Years Day game at Ralph Wilson Stadium the Snow Bowl, but in Buffalo they called it the Ice Bowl. No matter  heres how it looked in The Buffalo News.

title: Bloggingheads: Orwellian Times?
description:
Jack Balkin of Yale Law School, left, and Eric Posner of the University of Chicago Law School debate whether government surveillance today is worse than during the Cold War.
Go to Bloggingheads.tv

title: Memories of oil futures past
description: Rupert Murdoch, on the eve of the invasion of Iraq:

title: Constructing History
description: Images of the work of Jack Fisk, production designer for "There Will Be Blood."

title: 'Hansel and Gretel'
description: An excerpt from the second live HD transmission of this season, a matinee performance of the Met's new production of Humperdinck's "Hansel and Gretel."

title: Blogtalk: Iowa Aflutter
description: The Caucus can only be in so many places at once, especially on a day like this, and were not able to capture every handshake or gem of a quote spoken out on the trail. Fortunately, wonky Iowans run some pretty good blogs. Here are a few brief gems from todays coverage of caucus eve:

title: Golden Globe Backers In Talks With Writers
description: The Hollywood Foreign Press Association, the sponsor of the Golden Globe Awards, said on Wednesday it began discussions with the Writers Guild of America on December 29 to get an interim agreement similar to the one David Lettermans company, Worldwide Pants, reached with the WGA to put The Late Show with David Letterman back on the air, Reuters reports.

title: Striking Writers Deliver Top Ten List
description: David Letterman officially made his return to late-night television just after 4:30 on Wednesday afternoon, when he opened the taping of Wednesday nights show by passing through a chorus line of long-legged showgirls clad in white tie and bearing placards that read, Writers Guild of America on Strike,' Jacques Steinberg and Bill Carter report.

title: Prankster Playing Bhuttos Son on Facebook Fools News Outlets
description: UPDATED

title: Clinton Appears on Letterman
description: Jacques Steinberg and Bill Cater report that David Lettermans return to late-night television tonight features a greeting from Hillary Rodham Clinton. After the taping of the show was concluded, the shows producers inserted a one-line joke to precede the hosts entrance  delivered not by Mr. Letterman but by Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, via satellite from Iowa, on the eve of the states presidential caucuses.

title: Obamas 2-Minute Spot: Leader
description: In Barack Obamas last appeal to Iowans for their support, the candidate asks voters to consider, who can take us in a fundamentally new direction?

title: Huckabee Goes Positive in New Ads
description: Now that he canned his own negative ads against Mitt Romney, Mike Huckabee is out with new positive spots, which he is running in both Iowa and New Hampshire. One focuses on his anti-abortion stance, and with his mention of the word values (or some variation thereof) four times in the 30-second ad, its clear exactly what type of voter he is trying to get to come out for him tomorrow.

title: Giulianis Warning on Readiness
description: Updated Rudolph W. Giuliani has released a graphic new ad, which will begin running on Fox News Channel and in Florida and New Hampshire on Thursday. The spot has footage riots, bombings and general unrest in the Muslim world, as a voiceover narrates:

title: An Endorsement the Edwards Camp Isnt Bragging About
description: DES MOINES  About that Ralph Nader endorsement of John Edwards. It came out in an interview with Mr. Nader in Politico about 8 p.m. on New Years Eve. But heres the interesting thing. The Edwards campaign never put out a release about it.

title: Edwards Closes With Supporters Voice
description: Updated John Edwards, known for his closing arguments both as a trial lawyer and as a candidate in Iowa in 2004, is letting a supporter do it for him this time around.

title: Garden
description: Where to go for a dose of spring in midwinter.

title: Marquee Mismatches: Blame the System
description: After a magical season that will resonate as one of the grandest in college football history, the postseason is ending with a thud.

title: Huckanomics
description: Former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabees Republican primary campaign has stood out from the Republican pack for its appeals to the economic anxieties of hard-pressed Iowans. At every stop he remind voters of his own humble roots son of a firefighter who worked a second job, one generation from dirt floors and outhouses on his mothers side and tells that that he is the candidate who will look out for the guy who can barely make the payments on his used pick-up truck.

title: Mitt Romney's Closing Pitch
description: Mitt Romney speaks to voters on Jan. 1. (NBC Video)

title: Economists Warm Up to Edwards
description: Two weeks ago, in an article  about John Edwards, Mitt Romney and their attitude toward economic inequality, I wrote the following about Mr. Edwards:

title: The Title Game: 10 Stories Worth Following
description: With Ohio State and Louisiana State having arrived in New Orleans, now is the time to look at 10 story lines worth following heading into the Bowl Championship Series title game Monday.1. The Hat vs. the Vest  L.S.U. Coach Les Miles is nicknamed the Hat because of the stiff brim he wears during games. Ohio State Coach Jim Tressel is known as the Vest because of his typical game-day sweater vest. Miles has become the known as the consummate sideline gambler, and Tressel is usually as conservative as his attire. But few will gives Miles the strategic edge here because Tressel has won too many big games by close margins.2. The Speed Factor  After Florida, like L.S.U. a team in the Southeastern Conference, routed Ohio State in last seasons title game, team speed was cited as a strong factor. That came into play especially with the Gators defensive front seven. Expect the speed factor as an advantage for L.S.U. to be discussed excessively leading up to the game.3. The Imperfect Quarterback  Plenty of observers are going to say that this Ohio State team is better than last seasons. Well, its not. The disparity at quarterback is enough of a reason, as the Buckeyes traded the Heisman Trophy winner, Troy Smith, for the immobile and not-so-accurate Todd Boeckman. L.S.U. has the solid-but-unspectacular Matt Flynn, which means that whichever quarterback makes the least mistakes will probably win.

title: Tom Hanks Battles Contractor
description: In some ways its reassuring to know that even celebrities squabble with contractors.

title: OBrien Improvises, Saying Sadly, We Do Not Have Our Writers With Us
description: Conan OBrien, sporting a red-hued beard on the first new Late Night in two months, spent time finding ways to improvise on camera, Jacques Steinberg and Bill Carter report. He had someone clock how long he could spin his wedding ring on his desk (36 seconds) and made a running gag of sipping water from a mug. Thats good water, he told the audience, adding, Killed some time.'

title: Leno Presents Ten Minute Monologue
description: On his first night back on The Tonight Show, Jay Leno offered a monologue that included jokes he said he had crafted beforehand. Whether that violated rules of the striking Writers Guild of America  to which Leno belongs  was not immediately clear, the Associated Press reports.

title: Clintons Late-Night Rally on Caucus Eve
description: DES MOINES  After hundreds of rallies and speeches in Iowa since her first on Jan. 27, 2007, Hillary Rodham Clinton held her last big campaign event at the Historical Society building here, urging voters to pick a president when they gather for the first-in-the-nation Iowa caucuses Thursday evening.

title: Betting on His Troops
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa

title: Talk Shows Return as Strike Continues
description: The writers strike has upset the natural order of television, and that topsy-turviness was not set right with the return of late-night talk shows on Wednesday.

title: Netflix Partners With LG to Bring Movies Straight to TV
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Netflix, the DVD-by-mail company with more than seven million customers, has a new strategy that may one day make those red envelopes obsolete.

title: Ruth Wallis,  Singer-Writer of Risqu Songs, Dies at 87
description: Ruth Wallis, a cabaret singer of the 1940s, 50s and 60s who was known as the Queen of the Party Song for the genteelly risqu numbers she performed for happy, and very occasionally horrified, listeners worldwide, died on Dec. 22 at her home in South Killingly, Conn. She was 87.

title: Grandma, Cousin Billy, Christian Dior
description: LITTLE more than a decade ago, Stanley Marcus, the merchandising wizard who turned Neiman Marcus into the countrys leading luxury retailer, pulled up in a Cadillac at the Dallas residence of one of his 10 grandchildren and deposited nearly 35 years worth of personal photographs on the porch. He was moving from the home he had lived in for some 50 years and was clearing out the closets.

title: Fund Manager Faces Legal Siege Over Investments
description: The State Street Corporation, which manages $2 trillion for pension funds and other institutions, ousted a senior executive on Thursday and said it would set aside $618 million to cover legal claims stemming from investments tied to mortgage securities.

title: Home-Office Life and Its Discontents
description: BEFORE they were married in September, Nicci Young and Richard Wiese first had to split up. The problem was not romantic, but spatial: Ms. Young Wiese, who organizes community development safaris to Africa, and Mr. Wiese, a writer and explorer, found that their Upper East Side one-bedroom was not big enough for the two of them after both decided to work from home.

title: Tom Wolfe Leaves Longtime Publisher, Taking His New Book
description: Tom Wolfe, the author of sprawling social novels like The Bonfire of the Vanities and A Man in Full, has severed his 42-year relationship with Farrar, Straus & Giroux and agreed to sell the rights to publish his next novel, to be set in Miami, to Little, Brown & Company. People involved in the negotiations said on Wednesday that Mr. Wolfes advance for the new book was close to $7 million.

title: Correction: Is This a Toothbrush or a Drill Sergeant?
description: The Skin Deep column on Dec. 20, about dental care, referred incorrectly to the Ultreo, a sonic brush that signals how long to brush each tooth. It should be moved around on the tooth during these intervals; it should not be stationary.

title: Fresh-Faced Buccaneers Take Nothing for Granted
description: TAMPA, Fla.  In the reception area of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers enormous new practice facility stand nine life-size statues depicting the waning moments of the teams Super Bowl victory after the 2002 season.

title: Harry Potter Tops British Box Office
description: Harry Potter worked his magic last year when Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, the fifth in the adventures of the boy wizard, took in $97.95 million to become the top-grossing film at box offices in Britain and Ireland, the BBC reported. Runners-up were Pirates of the Caribbean: At Worlds End ($93.73 million); Shrek the Third ($76.56 million); and The Simpsons Movie ($76.4 million).

title: But First, Doctor, What Was Your Marathon Time?
description: YOU are an athlete, or, at least, very active. Should you seek doctors who are athletes, too? After all, some obese people pass around lists of fat friendly doctors who treat them with respect. Women often want female doctors.

title: A Young Ballerina Learns to Use Her Height to Artistic Advantage
description: Teresa Reichlen is a rarity at New York City Ballet, though for more than her angelic face, long legs and soaring jump, which manages to spring up and float in the air like silk. Whats unusual about Ms. Reichlen is that in the arduous quest to become a ballerina at a competitive and grueling company like City Ballet, her delicacy hasnt turned into brittleness.

title: A Courtroom Voice
description: ATLANTIC, Iowa

title: With Builder in Bankruptcy, Buyers Are Left Out
description: MURRELLS INLET, S.C.  Ettore and Larisa Costanzo are showing off their new house, which they love madly.

title: What Libraries Stand For
description: To the Editor:

title: Clemenss Interview Could Lead to Lawsuit
description: Roger Clemens will face a lawsuit if he says in a 60 Minutes interview that his former personal trainer, Brian McNamee, was not truthful when he said he injected Clemens with performance-enhancing drugs, a lawyer hired by McNamee said Wednesday.

title: 4 Cameras Middling Only in Price
description: Little silver pocket cameras are small and cheap, they take movies, and they dont turn you into a tourist clich by dangling from your neck.

title: World Business Briefing: Middle East: Israel: I.B.M. Acquires Data Storage Company
description: I.B.M. bought an Israeli data-storage provider, XIV, to meet growing demand for digital archiving. Financial terms were not disclosed. I.B.M., based in Armonk, N.Y., has bought about two dozen data-management companies since 2001 to bolster sales of software for storing, gaining access to and analyzing data. XIV, which is privately held, was founded in 2002 by five graduates of Talpiot, an Israeli military technology training program. The company, based in Tel Aviv, has about 50 employees.

title: Chain Said to Seek Bids for Weather Channel
description: The Weather Channel, one of the last privately owned cable channels, is being put up for sale and could fetch more than $5 billion, according to people briefed on the auction. The channel and its rapidly growing Web site, weather.com, are already attracting interest from some of the biggest names in media, including NBC, a unit of General Electric; the News Corporation; and Comcast, these people said.

title: No Homecoming for Preserved Head
description: A French court has barred the proposed repatriation of the mummified and tattooed head of a Maori warrior, Agence France-Presse reported. Last year a museum in Rouen, Normandy, where the head had been held since it was donated by a French collector in 1875, decided to return it to New Zealand as an ethical gesture of respect for the Maori people. But the French culture ministry intervened, arguing that the relic was part of Frances cultural heritage. On Dec. 27 an administrative court, in effect, blocked the transfer when it ruled that authorities in Rouen had failed to consult a scientific committee before withdrawing the head from the museums collection. Before their trade was outlawed, preserved heads of warriors with facial tattoos were popular with 19th-century European collectors.

title: Justice Dept. Sets Criminal Inquiry on C.I.A. Tapes
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Michael B. Mukasey said Wednesday that the Justice Department had elevated its inquiry into the destruction of Central Intelligence Agency interrogation videotapes to a formal criminal investigation headed by a career federal prosecutor.

title: Man Fatally Shot by Officers Was Armed Fugitive, Police Say
description: The man who was fatally shot by two New York City police officers on Tuesday night when he aimed a silver revolver at them was a fugitive suspected of shooting an officer in Georgia in 2005, police officials said Wednesday.

title: Neediest Cases Fund-Raising Totals
description: Previously recorded $4,236,469

title: The Title Game: 10 Stories Worth Following
description: With Ohio State and Louisiana State having arrived in New Orleans, now is the time to look at 10 story lines worth following heading into the Bowl Championship Series title game Monday.

title: Unwilling New Frontier for Migrants: 3 Greek Isles
description: SAMOS, Greece  Six men and a woman crouch in the dark against the wall of the coast guard headquarters. An officer wearing camouflage fatigues barks: Name? Papa? Age?

title: Obsessed With Nutrition? Thats an Eating Disorder
description: Not all scientific study of Mars is about extraterrestrial exploration. Some of it is about chocolate. Scientists at Mars Corporation have found evidence that the flavanols in cocoa have beneficial effects on the heart, thus allowing Mars to market products like its health-minded Rich Chocolate Indulgence Beverage.

title: Nets Rally From a 15-Point Deficit to Edge Magic
description: ORLANDO, Fla. (AP)  Jason Kidd just missed having a triple-double and made a key defensive stop as the Nets overcame a 15-point deficit to defeat the Orlando Magic on Wednesday night, 96-95.

title: Egypt Permits Pilgrims to Cross Back Into Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  Egypt allowed about 2,000 Palestinian pilgrims to cross back into the Gaza Strip on Wednesday after they had been stranded for days in the Egyptian Sinai on their way back from Mecca in Saudi Arabia.

title: Library Admits Damage to 18th-Century Diary
description: The British Library has admitted that a historic diary was damaged while in its care, but refused to confirm reports that the manuscript, which recorded preparations for the Jacobite rebellion of 1715, had been left in the trunk of a car, the BBC reported. A library spokeswoman, who refused to confirm that allegation, reported in The Times of London, said that an internal investigation had been conducted, though details remained confidential. But she said that a staff member had since left. The diary had been entrusted to the library in 1994 by its owner, Peter J. Tyldesley, who said he believed it would be safer there than in his home. It was written by his ancestor Thomas Tyldesley, prominent among the Jacobites, who supported the claims to the throne of the exiled Stuart king James II and his descendants. Peter Tyldesley, a lawyer, said he wanted to weep when he discovered oily stains on the pages last spring.

title: Ambition and Horror in Kenya
description: The murderous tribal violence that has spread through Kenya in recent days would be horrifying anywhere. It is particularly tragic to see this happening in a country that seemed finally to be on the path to a democratic and economically sound future. There may still be a chance to retrieve some of these hopes. That will likely require stepping back from the suspicious and hastily declared election results that sparked this ugly upheaval.

title: Home & Garden Calendar
description: Tree Recycling

title: What Happened to Our America?
description: To the Editor:

title: Circuits: A Versatile Portable Player Can Carry a Tune From a Satellite, the Internet or a Hard Drive
description: There are essentially four ways to put music onto a portable player: rip it from a CD or other storage media, download it from the Internet, get it streamed from the Internet or receive it by satellite.

title: Hartford: Contractor Sentenced in Bankruptcy Fraud
description: A Simsbury electrical contractor who told investigators that he gave former Gov. John G. Rowland expensive cigars and Champagne in exchange for access to state business was sentenced on Wednesday to five years in prison for hiding personal assets from a bankruptcy court. The contractor, Kurt Claywell, was convicted in July of conspiracy to commit bankruptcy fraud for attempting to conceal more than $200,000 in assets during a 2005 bankruptcy filing.

title: States Hesitate to Lead Change on Executions
description: When a state panel recommended last April that Tennessee abandon the three chemicals used in executions across the nation in favor of the single drug usually used in animal euthanasia, the states corrections commissioner said no.

title: Heart Procedure for Paul McCartney
description: Paul McCartney underwent coronary angioplasty last year, Agence France-Presse reported, citing British news media reports on Wednesday. The procedure opens arteries to increase blood flow. A spokesman for Mr. McCartney, right, confirmed that the angioplasty took place. The Sun of London quoted an unidentified source as saying: Paul had been complaining about not feeling well and saw a Harley Street specialist at the London Clinic. Tests were carried out, and the decision was taken to operate. Paul had the angioplasty in a private hospital. It was all very routine, but any work on your heart is a big deal. The Sun quoted a friend as saying: Luckily Paul is in very good shape. He does regular exercise and is fit. He eats well and does not carry any excess weight. He has always been in exceptional health, which is remarkable when you think of the rock and roll lifestyle he once had. Although no specific date for the angioplasty was given, Mr. McCartney, 65, was well enough to perform with Kylie Minogue on a BBC New Year special.

title: Iowans Hear Barrage of Final Pleas for First 08 Votes
description: DES MOINES  A yearlong prelude to the presidential election drew to a frenzied close on Wednesday here as Iowans absorbed a final torrent of campaign arguments before the states caucuses formally open the race for the White House.

title: Volatility of the Markets Carries On in 2008
description: HOUSTON  Oil prices began the year with a volatile surge on Wednesday, briefly reaching $100 a barrel, a long-awaited milestone in an era of rapidly escalating energy demand and tightening supplies.

title: No Need to Fly South to See Blossoms in Winter
description: JANUARY is a time for gardeners in the North to take time out: to stand in a tropical world, looking at palm trees soaring toward glass domes, or, as I did the other day, step down into a warm, steamy sunken Victorian fernery, where hundreds of ferns of every imaginable shape and size thrive among rocks and waterfalls.

title: On Gadget Overload and Feeling Powerless
description: IN the end, all it took was a single wafer-thin mint to explode Mr. Creosote, the obese Monty Python character who couldnt stop eating.

title: How to Keep Momentum Going for Customers and Employees
description: Its the first week of the new year and, small retailers may ask, now what? Dont fall prey to the January lull, says Joel R. Evans, a marketing professor at the Zarb School of Business at Hofstra University and co-author of two books on marketing. He has identified the following ways to jump-start sales and avoid a post-holiday letdown:

title: Closing With a Rout, Georgia Hopes to Open Next Season as No. 1
description: NEW ORLEANS  Georgia Coach Mark Richt acknowledged that he could not believe how long his teams blowout victory of Hawaii in the Sugar Bowl went on.

title: Social Net Site Is Said to Be for Sale
description: Plaxo, an early social networking site that helps people keep their address books updated, is up for auction, people briefed on the offering said Wednesday night. The company, which has not made a profit, is seeking as much as $100 million, these people said.

title: Miraculous Recovery for Man Who Fell From Sky
description: Alcides Moreno plunged 47 stories that morning last month, clinging to his 3-foot-wide window washers platform as it shot down the dark glass face of an Upper East Side apartment building. His brother Edgar, who had been working with him, was killed when the platform landed.

title: Brazilian Lessons for 2008
description: RIO DE JANEIRO

title: Travel Book Publishers Try to Reclaim the Web
description: LONDON  About a dozen years ago, the Rough Guides and Lonely Planet series of travel books, rival bibles for the footloose and fancy free, crossed a new frontier onto the Internet. But they found their road maps to the digital future hard to read.

title: Putting Your Best Cyberface Forward
description: DO you bite your nails? Have you pierced your tongue? Is your tote bag emblazoned with the words Im not a plastic bag?

title: Curry Gets Message, Even if Team Does Not
description: The Madison Square Garden fans booed Eddy Curry as he was announced as a starter Wednesday night against Sacramento. But whether they agreed with the decision to reinsert him into the lineup, one inspired effort off the bench from Curry was all Coach Isiah Thomas needed to see.

title: Politics, Spreadsheets and More Are All Grist for the (Free) Game Mill
description: Two months ago, I was drowning in video games. In the pre-Christmas onslaught, games pour into every video game critics office as though blasted out of a fire hose; you need waders to slosh around in them. Then at the end of November the fire hose is shut off, a couple of final games drip out and there is a deafening silence until next autumn.

title: Britain: Patients Flee Fire at Top Hospital
description: A fire blazed across the top floors of the Royal Marsden Hospital in London, one of Europes leading cancer centers, forcing the evacuation of all the patients and staff members. No one was badly hurt in the blaze, which apparently began on the fourth floor and spread quickly, destroying the roof, sending black smoke billowing into the sky and seriously damaging five operating rooms and two wards. About 125 firefighters were called to the scene. In-patients  two who were undergoing surgery when the fire began  were admitted to other hospitals. Hospital officials said that part of the hospital might be able to open again on Thursday.

title: Marie-Jeanne, a Balanchine Ballerina, Dies at 87
description: Marie-Jeanne, an American ballerina long associated with George Balanchine and a member of the New York City Ballet during its first season, died on Friday in Austin, Tex. She was 87 and lived in a retirement home there.

title: The Slice of the Sliver Speaks
description: DES MOINES

title: On the Naming of Kristol as a Times Columnist
description: To the Editor:

title: ... And Iowa Now
description: Iowa City

title: Health Care at Age 65
description: To the Editor:

title: California Sues E.P.A. Over Denial of Waiver
description: SAN FRANCISCO  California sued the federal Environmental Protection Agency on Wednesday, challenging its recent decision to block California rules curbing greenhouse-gas emissions from new cars and trucks.

title: Giuliani Keeps Campaign Focus on Terrorism
description: HOOKSET, N.H.  With the political world focused on Iowa, Rudolph W. Giuliani released a graphic new television advertisement here Wednesday in which scenes of Osama bin Laden firing a rifle segue to the smoking wreckage of the World Trade Center.

title: The Right Move on the C.I.A. Tapes
description: The Justice Departments announcement that it has ordered a formal criminal investigation into the destruction of Central Intelligence Agency interrogation videotapes is a heartening, and unaccustomed, sign that the attorney general is doing his duty to get to the bottom of a roiling scandal.

title: Theater Team Makes an Ally of Random Circumstance
description: Just about all of the publicity materials and even some of the reviews of the Nature Theater of Oklahomas production of No Dice  a theater work consisting of seven actors performing bizarre dances and reciting telephone conversations about mundane topics  mention that the show is a whittled-down 4-hour version of an 11-hour monster epic.

title: A Yippie Role for Sacha Baron Cohen?
description: Having bade farewell to his creation Borat, Sacha Baron Cohen, below, is turning to Vietnam War politics to portray Abbie Hoffman, a co-founder of the quintessential 1960s protest group the Yippies, in a Steven Spielberg film The Trial of the Chicago Seven, The Sunday Times of London reported. The trial grew out of protests at the 1968 Democratic nominating convention in Chicago, where violence led to the trial of seven demonstrators, including Mr. Hoffman, who were accused of inciting a riot. Variety reported that a representative of Mr. Spielberg would neither confirm nor deny the Sunday Timess report. Mr. Hoffman committed suicide in 1989.

title: Under Pressure, Prosecutor in Texas Wont Run Again
description: HOUSTON  Eager to distance themselves from a political sex scandal, leaders of the Harris County Republican Party on Wednesday quashed the re-election plans of Texas most powerful prosecutor, District Attorney Charles A. Rosenthal Jr.

title: 2 African-American Women File Suit Against the Garden
description: Two African-American women who were security supervisors at Madison Square Garden accused arena management in a lawsuit filed Wednesday in Brooklyn Supreme Court of discriminating against them by giving them less-desirable assignments and favoring white employees despite their lesser qualifications.

title: Circuits: Out of the Camera Bag, but Still Protected, Encased in Shock-Absorbing Rubber Skin
description: While a padded bag can protect an expensive digital single-lens-reflex camera when it is not in use, there are also the potential bumps and dings after it leaves the bag. To help protect a camera while it is out and about, Made Products has come up with Camera Armor, a custom-fitted ergonomic suit for various S.L.R. models from Canon, Nikon, Sony, Olympus, Pentax and Fuji.

title: Obama Triumphs in Iowa Contest as Clinton Falters; Huckabee Rolls
description: DES MOINES  Senator Barack Obama of Illinois, a one-term Democratic senator trying to become the nations first African-American president, rolled to victory in the Iowa caucuses on Thursday night, lifted by what appeared to be a record turnout of voters who rejected the criticism that he did not have enough experience.

title: The Office, Housebroken
description: IT was not so long ago, Neal Zimmerman recalls, that the term home office meant something very different from what it does today. In the early 90s, when Mr. Zimmerman, a prominent workplace architect with offices in West Hartford, Conn., started designing residential work spaces, most people thought home office meant the headquarters of a company. Back then, the very idea of working at home had a certain stigma, except in a few vocations like freelance writing. In the popular imagination, he said, people who worked from home were usually laid off or couldnt hold down a job, or were peripheral to the work force.

title: Marquee Mismatches: Blame the System
description: After a magical season that will resonate as one of the grandest in college football history, the postseason is ending with a thud.

title: Toyota Ousts Ford From No. 2 Spot in U.S. Sales
description: DETROIT  The Ford Motor Companys United States sales fell 12 percent in 2007, allowing Toyota Motor of Japan to replace it as the countrys second largest seller of vehicles.

title: No Insurance, Poor Health
description: The case for providing health coverage for all Americans got even more compelling in the past week when two new studies presented the most comprehensive evidence yet that the lack of health insurance is seriously harmful to a patients health. The studies found that uninsured people suffer significantly worse outcomes from cardiovascular disease, diabetes and cancer than those who have coverage.

title: Pakistani Opposition Parties Decry Election Delay
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The main opposition parties denounced the governments decision on Wednesday to postpone parliamentary elections for six weeks after the assassination of the opposition leader Benazir Bhutto, but they said they would abide by the ruling.

title: Leno and Guild in Dispute Over His Monologue
description: Jay Leno made a triumphant return to late-night television Wednesday night, easily dominating the ratings competition over his chief rival, David Letterman, and delivering one of his traditional full-length monologues  even though he was performing without his team of 19 writers.

title: Fatigue Factor Gives Equal Time to Candidates
description: DES MOINES  Its the groggy, nerve-sizzling season on the trail, and forget the attack ads and last-minute scrapping. Any candidate will attest that the epic fight now is against sleep deprivation, the gaffe-inducing monster that looms over every campaign in its final hours.

title: Guard Mocked by Escaped Prisoners Is Found Dead
description: ELIZABETH, N.J.  The emotional blows had been landing with increasing frequency for Rudolph Zurick. In recent months, he mourned the death of his mother, a neighbor said. Then, in mid-December, Mr. Zurick, a corrections officer at the Union County Jail here, made the troubling discovery that two inmates had burrowed through a concrete wall in a daring escape.

title: After Talk of Titles, Knicks Tank Again
description: Isiah Thomas walked a red carpet. He shook hands with a well-wisher, who nodded toward the throng of people on Thomass heels. My posse, Thomas said, chuckling.

title: Short, Stout, Has a Handle on Colds
description: GABY HAKMAN worked as a chef in professional kitchens in Miami for nearly 20 years, standing in the vacuum of powerful venting fans, inhaling smoke. But she had even bigger nasal challenges ahead. I work as a personal chef now, which is a lot less toxic, but I also moved to New York City, and because of the citys pollutants and dry heat I developed painfully dry sinuses, Ms. Hakman said.

title: Brooklyn: Girls Left Alone Are Rescued From Blaze
description: Firefighters rescued two young girls from a burning apartment in Flatbush on Wednesday, and the man who left them unattended was charged with endangerment, the police said. The girls, who are sisters believed to be 1 and 3 years old, were taken to Kings County Hospital Center, where they were in stable condition after being treated for smoke inhalation. Their mother had left them in the care of her live-in companion, Steven Vassort, 23, but he went out, the police said. He was charged with two counts of child endangerment. The cause of the fire was not immediately determined.

title: Political Field Is Panned by Bloomberg
description: With unusually dismissive language, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg offered tart assessments of his potential presidential rivals at a news conference on Wednesday, suggesting they are offering meaningless bromides rather than serious answers to the problems confronting the country.

title: Inmate Escapes From Hospital
description: A 45-year-old prisoner being treated at a hospital in Maryland overpowered a guard, stole a gun, and carjacked a motorist as he escaped and fled early Wednesday morning, the authorities said.

title: New Jersey School Plan Hinges on Odd Alliances
description: TRENTON  Ever since Gov. Jon S. Corzine unveiled his plan three weeks ago to overhaul the way New Jersey finances its schools, he has witnessed the formation of unexpected alliances that either favor the new way he wants the state to dispense billions of dollars or strenuously oppose it.

title: Regional Bank in Ohio to Trim 900 Jobs
description: CLEVELAND (AP)  The regional bank National City Corporation said on Wednesday that it was cutting its dividend by nearly half and shutting its wholesale mortgage division, eliminating 900 jobs, because of weakened housing and credit markets.

title: Apartment Prices in Manhattan Defy National Real Estate Slide
description: As the housing market across the country continued to stagnate in the fourth quarter of last year, the market in Manhattan set a record, according to reports to be released on Thursday by four of the citys major real estate brokerage firms.

title: Residential Sales
description: Manhattan

title: Room to Improve
description: Q.  What kind of lighting should I install in my home theater?

title: George MacDonald Fraser, Author of Flashman Novels, Dies at 82
description: George MacDonald Fraser, a British writer whose popular novels about the arch-rogue Harry Flashman followed their hero as he galloped, swashbuckled, drank and womanized his way through many of the signal events of the 19th century, died yesterday on the Isle of Man. He was 82 and had made his home there in recent years.

title: A Laugh About the Lord
description: SERGEANT BLUFF, Iowa

title: Redefining Fit to Practice
description: THE problem with advising very active people to find doctors who are like them is that there may be no way to know whether a doctor is an athlete without calling and asking. But there are at least two professional organizations that try to help.

title: Domestic Issues Now Outweigh Iraq
description: DES MOINES  The Democratic and Republican presidential candidates are navigating a far different set of issues as they approach the Iowa caucuses on Thursday than when they first started campaigning here a year ago, and that is likely to change even more as the campaigns move to New Hampshire and across the country.

title: When Its Time to Get to Work
description: IT can be a pleasure to work at home in an office that is well set up. But not every home has an extra room that can be used as a work space, so outfitting an office often means being smart and efficient about carving out and furnishing a corner of a bedroom or a living room with office essentials.

title: Tankleff Says He Relishes Freedom
description: In his first few days after winning his freedom from prison, Martin H. Tankleff  who was sent to prison 17 years ago for two murders he insists he never committed  relished the things that were little more than routine to him a half a lifetime ago.

title: Practicing the Subtle Sell of Placing Products on Webisodes
description: AMERICAN EAGLE OUTFITTERS, the retailer that sells jeans, T-shirts and hoodies for the 15- to-25-year-old set, has been at the forefront of the trend toward advertainment, in which companies make videos to engross viewers while glamorizing a particular brand.

title: Staying on Message
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa

title: Well-Rested Buccaneers to Face Surging Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  As opposing quarterbacks in a wild-card playoff game Sunday, Eli Manning and Jeff Garcia will have a big impact on the result. But the late-season preparation of Mannings Giants and Garcias Buccaneers could not have been more different.

title: Januarys the Time to Get Shoppers Back in the Stores
description: FRESH off 80-hour workweeks in a sprint for holiday sales, it is little wonder that some entrepreneurs are escaping for a precious few days of sun and relaxation.

title: Stressing Experience
description: DERRY, N.H.

title: Three Generations of Help on the Way to a Team Title
description: The winners of the Swiss Teams at the Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional in Manhattan on Sunday were Jill Levin, Shane Blanchard, Peter Bonfanti, Robert Levin and Glenn Milgrim of New York and Stephen Shane of White Plains.

title: City Cuts Bronx Centers Aid, Citing Misuse of Funds
