description: A South Bronx day care center being investigated by the city for financial improprieties will lose its city financing next week and have to close, the fourth day care facility to be shuttered in the neighborhood in four years, officials said Wednesday.

title: You Go to the Movie Theater, and an Opera Breaks Out
description: Television broadcasts of opera have been around for a long time and have done much to demystify the art form. Still, its mostly recorded opera broadcasts that are seen on television these days.

title: White Plains: Ex-official at Nonprofit Group Admits Lying
description: A former chief financial officer of the nonprofit group the Institute for Cancer Prevention admitted in Federal District Court on Wednesday that he lied to federal agents who were checking on the use of grants awarded to the organization, prosecutors said. The former official, Roy Victor, pleaded guilty to obstruction of justice, Michael J. Garcia, the United States attorney in Manhattan, said in a statement. Prosecutors said Mr. Victor admitted that he lied repeatedly to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. He faces up to 10 years in prison.

title: Pakistan Turns to Britain for Help in Bhutto Inquiry
description: LONDON  Pakistans request for Scotland Yards help in investigating the assassination of Benazir Bhutto follows years of close and often successful cooperation between Pakistan and Britain on terrorist cases, especially since the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks in the United States. But British terrorism experts cautioned Wednesday against expectations of any early breakthroughs in the Bhutto killing.

title: Editors Note
description: The E-Commerce Report column in Business Day on Monday reported on Kijiji, a free classified ads online service owned by eBay that seeks to compete with Craigslist, the San Francisco-based company that manages classified ad sites in hundreds of cities. The column should have noted that eBay, based in San Jose, Calif., and Craigslist have a financial relationship. EBay bought a 25 percent stake in Craigslist in 2004.

title: Long Island Man Wont Be Tried Again in Murders
description: HAUPPAUGE, N.Y.  The Suffolk County district attorney said on Wednesday that he would not retry Martin H. Tankleff for the 1988 murders of his parents and that he would ask Gov. Eliot Spitzer to appoint a special prosecutor to reinvestigate the case.

title: Defendants Disarray Points to Instability, Lawyer Says
description: It was like one of those bad dreams in which one goes to school or rides the subway half-dressed.

title: Even France, Haven of Smokers, Is Clearing the Air
description: PARIS  Overnight, conviviality has taken on an entirely new meaning in France.

title: Egypt: 4 Women Die of Bird Flu
description: Bird flu has killed four Egyptian women in the past week, according to Egyptian health officials and the World Health Organization. The women, ages 25 to 50, were from different provinces, and the cases were not related, officials said. At least one was a chicken seller, and the others were said to have kept poultry at home. The H5N1 strain of avian flu appears endemic in Egyptian poultry; previously the last human case was in June. A total of 43 Egyptians have been infected with H5N1 since it arrived in early 2006; 19 died.

title: Circuits: Hi-Fi Earbuds for Hearing Less Noise and Higher Quality When Listening to Music on the iPhone
description: As Steven P. Jobs said when he introduced the iPhone, its not just a phone  its also a music player. It stands to reason, then, that music fans will want a pair of headphones that can reproduce the highs, lows and midranges they expect from their other music devices.

title: Law Amended to Shield Tax-Exempt Groups
description: Pension funds, university endowments and other organizations that are exempt from paying taxes will no longer be ensnared by a law intended to combat two notorious corporate tax shelters.

title: Lettermans Back, With a Greeting From Clinton
description: David Letterman officially made his return to late-night television just after 4:30 on Wednesday afternoon, when he opened the taping of Wednesday nights show by passing through a chorus line of long-legged showgirls clad in white tie and bearing placards that read, Writers Guild of America on Strike.

title: World Business Briefing: Europe: Finland: Nokia Siemens Makes Acquisition
description: Nokia Siemens Networks, a maker of wireless networks, agreed to buy Apertio for about 140 million euros ($206 million) to expand its subscriber data management services. Apertio has 237 employees and had sales of about 28 million euros in 2007, Nokia Siemens said. Nokia Siemens, which is a joint venture of Nokia and Siemens and is based in Espoo, Finland, expects the acquisition to close in the first quarter of this year. Apertios products are used by wireless and fixed phone operators. Apertio, based in Bristol, England, has operations in Continental Europe, Asia and the United States.

title: Anger and Blame After Deadly Flood in Northwest
description: CURTIS, Wash.  The big rain fell with fatal efficiency those first few days of December. It washed mud from mountainsides and lifted logs into the Chehalis River, which rose to a historic high as it roared downhill. Bridges broke. Cows drowned. Helicopters plucked people from rooftops.

title: Tip of the Week: How Stale Is That Web Page?
description: If you have a sneaking suspicion that the Web page youre looking at is old and stale, you can take a peek to see when it was last updated. In Internet Explorer or Firefox, just go to the address bar while the page is displayed in your browser and type in javascript:alert(document.lastModified) without the quotation marks. Hit the Enter key to see a box that tells you when the page youre viewing was updated.

title: Recording Calls Over the Net
description: Q. Is there a way to record Internet voice chats on the computer?

title: Corrections
description: Editors' Note

title: Discussion of a Fed Cut Only Stirs Up Concerns About a Weak Economy
description: Wall Street stumbled out of the blocks for the new year after oil prices surged briefly to $100 a barrel and a report pointing to a fall in manufacturing activity in December revived fears that the economy would falter in 2008.

title: Garden Q.&A.
description: Eggplants in Love

title: Rangers Cooled by the Red-Hot Iginla
description: CALGARY, Alberta (AP)  Jarome Iginla scored two goals to lead the Calgary Flames to a 4-3 victory over the Rangers on Wednesday night.

title: Footnotes
description: Eddie Murphy, whose acting credits include Beverly Hills Cop, The Nutty Professor and Dr. Dolittle, married the film producer Tracey Edmonds on New Years Day on a private island off Bora Bora in French Polynesia, The Associated Press reported. ... As many as 1.1 million people watched the live broadcast of the traditional New Years concert of the Vienna Philharmonic, Agence France-Presse reported. The performance, led by Georges Prtre, was broadcast around the world on 54 television channels and 35 radio stations. ... More than 30 dramas, documentaries and shorts will be shown when the Jewish Museum and the Film Society of Lincoln Center present the 17th annual New York Jewish Film Festival, from Jan. 9- 24. Films will be shown at the Walter Reade Theater and at the museum in Manhattan.

title: For Iowas Democrats, Too Many Good Picks
description: AMES, Iowa  If conversations with undecided Democrats here were turned into a play, it would consist of the same dialogue repeated over and over again, with slight variations:

title: Stealing From a Biker Gang
description: ROCK N ROLL, the art world, Hollywood and fashion have swiped inspiration from biker style so often that its a wonder there is anything left to purloin. This has been the case in every two-wheeled decade, and rarely more so than now, when the hip artist du jour Richard Prince seems to have motorcycle culture firmly in the pincers of his ironic quotations, and style avatars like Kate Moss have taken to kitting themselves up like Hells Angels mamas.

title: Devils Start Fast to Stay Hot at Home
description: NEWARK (AP)  The Devils finally found the net in an opening period.

title: The Bratty and the Beautiful
description: WALKING into Hickey, a new store of handsome and impetuous mens clothes in SoHo, you may notice on the far wall a large black-and-white photo print of a beautiful male model. His symmetrical slitty eyes, long, perfect nose and pouty flower-petal lips are framed by a corona of blond hair styled in a beachy sea-salt scraggle.

title: Bronx: Man Is Fatally Shot
description: A 20-year-old man was shot to death about 8:30 p.m. on Wednesday in an apartment building in Mott Haven, the police said. Officers responding to a 911 call found the man lying in a hallway on the 18th floor of the building, at 360 East 137th Street. The man, whom the police did not identify, suffered multiple gunshot wounds and was pronounced dead at the scene. There were no arrests and no known motive, the police said.

title: Not Exactly the Jetsons, but Getting Closer
description: Robots are still far from being the chatty companions seen in science-fiction movies. But some toy robots are becoming more than just conversation pieces.

title: Lottery Numbers
Father Says He Set Fire That Killed Three
description: CHICAGO  A man set a fire last weekend that killed his pregnant daughter, his son-in-law and his 3-year-old grandson, prosecutors say, because he disapproved of his daughters marriage.

title: Investor Adds to Zale Stake
description: WASHINGTON (Reuters)  Richard C. Breeden, the former Securities and Exchange Commission chairman who is now an activist investor, has raised his stake in the Zale Corporation, the jeweler, to 13.3 percent from 7.7 percent, according to a regulatory filing made Wednesday.

title: $30 Million Fine for Mileage Violations
description: DaimlerChrysler paid a $30 million fine in 2007, the most ever by an automaker, for failing to meet federal fuel-efficiency standards, according to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: Teenagers in the City Smoke Less, Report Finds
description: Health officials reported on Wednesday that smoking among New York Citys teenagers had continued to drop in 2007 at a rate faster than among adults in the city, and is now far lower than among teenagers nationwide. The drop was due mainly to high cigarette taxes and curbs on public smoking, they said.

title: Hospital Cardiac Arrest Response Often Too Slow
description: When patients in the hospital suddenly go into cardiac arrest, the staff often takes too long to respond, increasing the risk of brain damage and death, a new study finds.

title: Garcias a Nemesis That Really Gets Around
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  It may only be a coincidence that the Giants are again facing a team in the playoffs led by quarterback Jeff Garcia. Or it may be much deeper than that, another chance to come full circle.

title: Lockheed Settles Discrimination Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters)  The Lockheed Martin Corporation, the military contractor, has agreed to pay a former employee $2.5 million, more than any person has received in the settlement of a racial discrimination case filed by the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, lawyers for the agency said on Wednesday.

title: Huckabee Stresses His Humble Roots and Anti-Abortion Stance
description: Former Governor Mike Huckabee of Arkansas sharpened his pitch to Iowa voters that his humble roots gave him a better understanding of the problems of working people than his rival, Mitt Romney, a former private equity fund manager.

title: Anarchy Rules: The Dishes Stay Dirty
description: THERE are certain things you can count on in a punk house. A killer name: Anarchtica, Scribble Squat, Collective A Go-Go, Firebreathing Kangaroo. Lots of bikes and skateboards. Homemade tattoos. A tattered photocopy of Soy, Not Oi!, the vegan anarchists Joy of Cooking. Guests are always welcome in a punk house, if they follow the rules: Dont be a jerk! reads a guest policy sign in one.

title: Trenton: Medicaid Payments Increase for Child Treatments
description: Doctors who care for poor children in New Jersey are receiving an increase in Medicaid reimbursements for the first time in two decades, with payments more than tripling. Under the new rate, which started on Tuesday, physicians are being paid $73.70 from Medicaid for each childs visit, up from $23.03; dentists will see payments jump to $64 for each exam from $18.02. Its a big step toward providing more access for our clients, said Jennifer Velez, commissioner of the New Jersey Department of Human Services. The new rates will also help the department attract new providers, she said.

title: The Coaching Carousel May Lead to Reunions
description: Rob Ryans expected departure as the defensive coordinator of the Oakland Raiders could set off an episode of All in the Family in the N.F.L.

title: Urban Success Story, With Hint of Unease for Poorer Residents
description: WHITE PLAINS

title: A High-Definition Projector for Those Who Think Big-Screen Televisions Are Not Quite Big Enough
description: Even as the prices of L.C.D. and plasma TVs slide, high-definition projectors remain expensive  but at least they are getting considerably better. The Sony Bravia VPL-VW40 front projector, for example, costs $3,000 but displays images at a vertical resolution of 1,080 lines and 60 frames a second, the highest on the market.

title: Time Away a Good Choice for Marbury
description: Stephon Marbury was doing his job again Wednesday night, a full month after the death of his father, Don, on Dec. 2.

title: With Nods to the Strike, Late-Night Hosts Return
description: Eight weeks after their writers went on strike and plunged their shows into reruns, Jay Leno, David Letterman and Conan OBrien returned to late-night television Wednesday with original shows in which both the Iowa caucuses and the new facial hair on two of the hosts loomed large.

title: Iowa Then...
description: Cupertino, Calif.

title: Compositions That Come Naturally
description: Frederick Law Olmsted, with his Victorian whiskers, grandiloquent diction and vaguely utopian transcendentalism, might have been alarmed to learn that many decades after his death in 1903 he would become a hero of postmodern art.

title: Bill Bonanno, 75, Mob Family Member, Dies
description: Salvatore (Bill) Bonanno, whose appointment by his father to the second most powerful position in the Bonanno crime family in the mid-1960s touched off what became known as the Banana Wars and led to the exile of the Bonannos to Arizona, died on Tuesday at his home in Tucson. He was 75.

title: NBCs 'Loser' a Winner
description: NBCs couples edition of The Biggest Loser got off to a solid start in the ratings on Tuesday as 10.4 million viewers tuned in from 8 to 10 p.m. for the shows debut, according to Nielsens overnight estimates. Among adults 18 to 49, the episode fared better than any of the four previous premieres of the series, boosting NBC to a second-place finish on the night. Fox led the night over all with its Sugar Bowl coverage, although exact audience figures for the football game were unavailable on Wednesday. CBS and ABC ranked third and fourth for the night. CBS finished third in total viewers thanks to repeats of NCIS at 8 (11.7 million) and The Unit at 9 (7.4 million), followed by 48 Hours Mystery at 10 (6 million). ABC edged past CBS for third in the 18-to-49 set, benefiting from an overrun of its Rose Bowl coverage in the 8 p.m. hour, but struggling at 9 with two episodes of According to Jim, which drew under 5 million viewers each. NBCs Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (12.3 million) dominated the 10 p.m. hour among nonsports programming.

title: Yonkers: House Fire Kills Elderly Couple
description: The police blamed space heaters for a house fire that killed a married couple in their 80s on Wednesday. Fire officials said the fast-moving fire was fueled by clothing, papers and other clutter piled five feet high throughout the house. The couple, Caroline and Leo Gorynski, were found inside. Deputy Fire Chief John Flynn said that the fire started when space heaters ignited some of the clutter, and that there was clothing on top of the heaters. The Fire Department said the couple had nailed their front door shut, but Chief Flynn said that that did not delay the search for the victims. Ms. Gorynski, 88, was pronounced dead at the scene, and Mr. Gorynski, 87, died a short time later at a hospital.

title: Ending a Long Journey
description: MASON CITY, Iowa

title: Hospitals Slow in Heart Cases, Research Finds
description: In nearly a third of cases of sudden cardiac arrest in the hospital, the staff takes too long to respond, increasing the risk of brain damage and death, a new study finds.

title: Congressional Crackdown on Lobbying Is Already Showing Cracks
description: WASHINGTON  The party sponsored by the Distilled Spirits Council of the United States to celebrate the Senate majority leader, Bill Frist, at the New York Yacht Club was one of the more over-the-top events of the Republican National Convention in 2004, featuring 10 bars and more than a half-dozen special vintage Scotches. The group held a similar soiree that year for Senator Tom Daschle, the minority leader, at the Democratic Convention in Boston.

title: Casting The Seagull
description: Alan Cumming will join Dianne Wiest in the Classic Stage Companys production of Chekhovs Seagull, which is to run from Feb. 20 to March 30. Viacheslav Dolgachev, the artistic director of the Moscow New Drama Theater, is directing.

title: Jones Wants to Stay, but Its Hawaiis Call
description: Leigh Steinberg, the agent for Hawaii Coach June Jones, said he expected a decision on Joness future to be made in a fairly rapid time frame.

title: Cancer Diagnosis Upends Familys Finances and Relationships
description: On a recent evening in Washington Heights, Gertrudy Cuevas was longingly remembering her old factory job, where six years ago she started out sewing seat covers but in time proved that, despite her small frame, she was strong enough to build heavy furniture.

title: Kenya, Known for Its Stability, Topples Into Post-Election Chaos
description: KIAMBAA, Kenya  Daniel Kibigo said he was there, hiding in the burned cornfields nearby, as the mob gleefully stuffed mattresses in front of the churchs doors and set them on fire.

title: Comic Books in the Classroom
description: Generations of children grew up reading comic books on the sly, hiding out from parents and teachers who saw them as a waste of time and a hazard to young minds. Comics are now gaining a new respectability at school. That is thanks to an increasingly popular and creative program, often aimed at struggling readers, that encourages children to plot, write and draw comic books, in many cases using themes from their own lives.

title: Italy: Milan Introduces Traffic Fee
description: Milan joined London, Stockholm and Singapore among cities imposing congestion charges on drivers in an effort to improve the air quality in one of Europes most polluted urban centers. Vehicles entering the citys center on weekdays will be charged up to $14 a day, depending on the amount of pollution their models produce. Electric, hybrid and some low-polluting cars are exempt, as are most scooters. About 90,000 cars cross the charge area daily, according to the citys Web site. The city intends to curb particle matter circulation by 30 percent. Particle matter pollution originates mainly from traffic, heating and industry.

title: Attacker Bombs Pro-U.S. Sunnis in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  A suicide bomber in turbulent Diyala Province detonated an explosive vest on Wednesday at a checkpoint operated by armed Sunni Arab tribesmen who have turned against Al Qaeda in Mesopotamia and pledged support to the United States military.

title: Wipe Your PC for Safetys Sake
description: Q. Im about to give my six-year-old Windows XP computer to a friend. Short of reformatting the hard drive, is there any way to expunge my identity  my name, for instance, automatically supplied to certain forms  from the nooks and crannies of the machine? Is there software to restore a system to pre-ownership state?

title: X68 Express Bus From Midtown to Floral Park, Queens
description: The 5.34 p.m. Bus (which departed at 5:49 p.m.)

title: Stinky Cheese! Ambassador for Childrens Literature
description: Jon Scieszka, the author of witty and subversive childrens favorites like The True Story of the Three Little Pigs and The Stinky Cheese Man and Other Fairly Stupid Tales, is to be named the countrys first national ambassador for young peoples literature on Thursday, a kind of childrens book version of the Library of Congresss poet laureate program.

title: Circuits: A Tablet PC That Is Receptive to a Soft Touch, but Offers a Full Keyboard for Serious Tapping
description: Long before the computer mouse, the human finger was the original pointing device. Now Dell, with its new Latitude XT Tablet PC, has created a lightweight portable computer with capacitive touch capabilities that can accept on-screen input from finger taps as well as a plastic stylus.

title: Respond to Todays Column: The Slice of the Sliver Speaks
description: We invite you to leave your responses to the Thursday, Jan. 3 column.

title: Pakistan: A View from the D.J. Booth
description: Munizeh Sanai, host of "The Rush Hour," in Karachi, Pakistan discusses the current unrest in the country.

title: Whats Been Missing? Late Night!
description: No ones sure how weve survived these last few months without the political put-downs and humor of late-night television. Its been so long.

title: Pushing the Wrong Buttons
description: So, Britney Spears has taken up with a paparazzo. But for celebrity photographers, crossing the line can have its drawbacks:

title: Late Night Is Back! Hope You Like Strike Jokes.
description: Eight weeks after their writers went on strike, Jay Leno, David Letterman and Conan OBrien returned to late-night TV last night  the latter two sporting beards (gray and red respectively). Highlights:

title: A Love Letter to Giants Fans
description: Reader comments tend to run toward criticism and cynicism. Nature of the beast. Satisfied fans have no reason to write. Unhappy fans need a venue to vent. (Weve all been there. Click here for a rundown of acts of rage committed after Giants losses.)

title: Praise the Lord; Pass the Quips
description: Mike Huckebee continually taps the genre of humor you might call the Jesus joke:

title: Vinci Buys Stake in French Airports Operator
description: Shares in the government-controlled Aroports de Paris, operator of Charles de Gaulle and Orly airports, soared Wednesday after a French construction company said that it had acquired a 3.3 percent stake.

title: Clean Energy Investments Top $100 Billion
description: Despite the global credit crunch in 2007, new investment in clean energy industries like wind and solar power rose sharply to break through the $100 billion barrier for the first time, a research group, New Energy Finance, said Wednesday.

title: Ritchie Capital Returns Investor Fire Over Fund
description: A week after some investors tried forcing it into bankruptcy, Ritchie Capital defended management of its multi-strategy hedge fund and warned other investors that the groups legal action could cause further damage to the value of your investment.

title: Singapores China Easter Bid Hits Turbulence
description: A Singapore Airlines bid to buy a 24 percent stake in China Eastern Airlines appeared to be in trouble Wednesday after a major shareholder criticized the deal as unfair.

title: I.B.M. Acquires Israeli Data Storage Company
description: I.B.M. bought an Israeli data-storage provider, XIV, to meet growing demand for digital archiving. Financial terms were not disclosed.

title: EchoStar Spinoff Begins Trading
description: Shares of EchoStar Communicationss technology unit began trading on Wednesday as part of its founders plan to raise the valuations of the companys operations.

title: Private-Equity Backed Retailers Look Vulnerable
description: For dozens of retailers that went through leveraged buyouts in the last three years, a lot may be riding on a successful holiday season. Amid a housing slump, high energy prices and growing concern of a possible recession, some highly leveraged companies could face difficulties if consumer confidence ebbs, The Deal.com notes.

title: Peltzs Interest in Marsh & McLennan Refuels Deal Chatter
description: News that the activist investor Nelson Peltz and his companies have been cleared by the Federal Trade Commission to buy shares of Marsh & McLennan, the insurance broker, added fuel to speculation that the company might go on the block.

title: Citadel Said to Eye Centro Stake
description: Centro Properties Group, Australias second high-profile victim of a global credit crunch, is attracting interest from the Citadel Investment Group, according to press reports.

title: Europe Sees More Canceled Offerings Than U.S.
description: The number of postponed and canceled flotations in Europe last year was almost five times higher than in the United States, despite the origins of last summers credit crisis and equity market volatility lying in the United States mortgage market.

title: Weather Channel Said to Seek $5 Billion in Auction
description: The Weather Channel, one of the last privately owned cable channels, is being put up for sale and could fetch more than $5 billion, The New York Times reported.

title: Digital Single-Lens Reflex Cameras: A Comparison Chart
Commerzbank Replaces 2 U.S. Executives
description: The co-chief of Commerzbanks United States business and its New York-based head of credit have exited the bank in the wake of loss-making investments in subprime mortgages.

title: Wrong-Way Wall Street Predictions
description: For many Wall Street chief executives, the penalty for getting it wrong these days is a cushy exit package. By that logic, David Weidner, the MarketWatch columnist, argues that he should be getting a big windfall for his not-so-prescient predictions for 2007. (One of them was that Wells Fargo and Wachovia would merge.)

title: Executive Leaves State Street Amid Write-Down
description: State Street, the worlds largest money manager for institutions, said it would post a $279 million charge in the fourth quarter and that the chief executive of its asset-management unit stepped down.

title: Nokia Siemens Buys Britains Apertio for $205 Million
description: Nokia Siemens Networks agreed on Wednesday to pay $205 million to acquire Apertio, a British maker of databases that consolidate mobile and wireline subscriber data on common servers.

title: S.E.C. May Lift Restrictions on Foreign Trading
description: Stock exchanges outside the United States, including the London Stock Exchange, could provide direct trading access to United States investors through brokers based in the United States for the first time under proposals being prepared by the Securities and Exchange Commission, The Financial Times reported.

title: Buyout Firms True Struggle: Finding the Exit?
description: The collapse of the $1.8 billion buyout of PHH, a mortgage and vehicle leasing company, by the Blackstone Group and General Electric, had industry observers Wednesday lamenting the failed deal as an ominous start to the new year and yet another example of the drastic changes that have torn through the debt markets since the summer of 2007.

title: Should Merrill Tap BlackRock Stake for Cash?
description: Over the weekend, a report claimed that Merrill Lynch was in fresh talks with Middle East and Asian funds about a new investment on top of the $6.2 billion injection it got from an investor group late last year. That prompted a few financial blogs to offer a different potential solution to Merrills financial woes: Sell off a piece of its 49.8 percent stake in BlackRock, the big money management firm.

title: Court Approves $12.6 Million to Portus Investors
description: Investors in a defunct Canadian hedge fund firm, Portus Alternative Asset Management, are due to get another 12.5 million Canadian dollars ($12.6 million).

title: A New Twist on Mobile Search: Human Guides
description: The Internet search service ChaCha always seemed like a bit of a throwback. In a Web populated by search services powered by sophisticated algorithms that provide instant answers, ChaCha relied on paid human guides to help you find things.

title: Sun Capital Said to Mull Hostile Bid for Kellwood
description: The private equity firm Sun Capital Partners may be readying a new weapon in its battle to acquire the beleaguered apparel maker Kellwood.

title: Breeden Raises Stake in Zale
description: Richard Breeden, the former Securities and Exchange Commission chairman-turned-shareholder activist, nearly doubled his stake in Zale, but the struggling middle-market jewelers shares are still sinking.

title: A Lucky Strike for Netflix?
description: Among the many unintended but perfectly predictable consequences of the Hollywood writers strike is that without new television episodes to watch, people are beginning to watch more DVDs.

title: 'In Defense of Food'
description: FOOD SCIENCE'S GOLDEN AGE

title: Tech Bankers Still Bullish on 2008, Survey Says
description: Technology bankers have enjoyed four consecutive record years of mergers and acquisitions in the tech sector. Even so, most of them say they plan to be even busier in 2008, according to a new survey by The 451 Group, which polled more than 110 bankers from about 70 different firms.

title: Fees for High-Yield Loans Said to Rise
description: High-yield lenders may have had to write down the value of some of their loans, causing some pain. But Bloomberg News said Thursday they appear to be making some of their money back.

title: Imperium Renewables Withdraws I.P.O. Plans
description: Imperium Renewables, a biodiesel producer, filed to withdraw its plan for an initial public offering, citing unfavorable market conditions.

title: Ford Says Tata Leads in Jaguar Bidding
description: Ford Motor said on Thursday that s Tata Motors of India was the front-runner to buy its European brands Jaguar and Land Rover.

title: Day Dreaming Again
description: In our ongoing quest to help you avoid your responsibilities, we here at the Diners Journal offer another set of responses from notable eaters who answered this question for us: If you jump on a plane right now, all expenses paid, where would you go eat? We hope that those of you truly dedicated to blowing off even more of your work day will add your own food travel fantasies.

title: A Crown of Digital Glory
description: Nikki Finke, who has been called many things, can now add Media Mensch of the Year, courtesy of The New York Observer. In part, she was chosen because she has used the Webs Wild West dynamics so effectively, especially during the writers strike.

title: Plaxo, a Social Network, Said to Be for Sale
description: Plaxo, an early social networking site that helps people keep their address books updated, is up for auction, according to The New York Times. The company, which has not made a profit, is seeking as much as $100 million.

title: John McCains Caucus Speech
description: The following is a transcript of Senator John McCain's address to supporters after the Iowa Caucuses, as provided by Congressional Quarterly via The Associated Press.

title: As the Globes Turn
description: Party planners hanging by their thumbs! Actors, caught between principles and their own petty egos! Foreign journalists watching their one day in the sun die before their very eyes! Man, this story has it all, including more hairpin turns than a steep canyon switchback.

title: Atonement = Hillary Clinton?
description: Awards Daily says that Atonement may be this years movie version of Hillary Clinton: A presumptive favorite that some are having trouble warming up to.

title: Hillary Is Another Britney Spears
description: Compare your reader jokes with the comedy offered by the returning late-night shows (see post below or click here). Hmmm. Might want to keep your jokes coming via the comment link below:

title: The Neediest Cases | Helping Survivors
description: After reading about the hardships of Holocaust and World War II survivors in Brooklyn, Dr. Robert Ivker was moved to do more than just donate. He got others to join him.

title: Manhattan Real Estate Isnt Slowing Down Just Yet
description: Even as the rest of the housing market stagnates, Manhattans seems to reach ever-new heights. The average price for an apartment shot up to $1.4 million in the last quarter of 2007, up 17.6 percent from the fourth quarter of 2006, Christine Haughney reports  but average prices were being pushed to record levels mainly because of the increasing number of apartments selling above $10 million.

title: Fox Hits the Gas
description: On Christmas Day, the Bagger and his extended family took a vote on what movie to watch. The Bagger threw a flag on P.S. I Love You because it sounded like the kind of thing that he would have to wear estrogen goggles to get through. Others in the group showed little interest in Charlie Wilsons War even though the Bagger, who has yet to see it, lobbied hard. In the end, Juno was the consensus choice, though Mrs. Bagger wondered how Shorty Bagger, age 11, and G.G. Donna, her 83-year-old grandma, would fare. The Bagger assured her that all would be well.

title: Fusion Ticket, or Late Night Joke?
description: Former Governor Mike Huckabee of Arkansas has had some harsh words for his Republican rival Mitt Romney, but in a night-before-the-caucus appearance on the Tonight Show with Jay Leno Wednesday night, he singled out Senator Barack Obama, a Democrat, for praise.

title: We Need a Browser for TVs
description: LGs deal with Netflix to put streaming movies on some LG televisions shows that we are entering the AOL era of Internet television. We are going to see a lot of similar announcements from the Consumer Electronics Show next week as TV makers build walled gardens of hand-picked Internet- delivered video content for their high-end sets that resemble the early online services like AOL, Prodigy and CompuServe. Well also see more set-top boxes with their own walled gardens, like Vudu.

title: N.H. Forecast: Segway to the Primary
description: Countdown: 5 days until the primary.

title: The Early Word: Its Showtime
description: Twas the morn before caucus, and all through the state, not a candidate was sleeping, the results they await

title: Iowa in Perspective
description: Dont expect their advice to actually be taken, but over the past few weeks several bigwigs of opinionland have urged their colleagues to discount the results of tonights Iowa caucuses. In a Dec. 18 Op-Ed in The Times, three prominent Iowans  a former editor of the editorial page of The Des Moines Register, a former director of the Iowa Poll and a former executive secretary of Iowas Freedom of Information Council who is now a professor emeritus of journalism at Drake University in Des Moines  urged journalists to demand the Iowa Democratic Party to release the actual vote count among caucus-goers, which is currently never disclosed to the press or made available for inspection.

title: Cellphone Users Slow Traffic
description: Talking on the cellphone while driving isnt just a safety risk. It also slows down traffic.

title: Young Man Killed by Tiger Was Quiet One, Witness Says
description: Did a group of young men taunt a Siberian tiger before it escaped from its enclosure at the San Francisco Zoo on Christmas Day and attacked them?

title: John Edwardss Caucus Speech
description: The following is a transcript of John Edwards's address to supporters after the Iowa Caucuses, as provided by Congressional Quarterly via The Associated Press.

title: Christian Conservatives and the Caucuses
description: Will Iowas conservative Christians turn out in force for Mike Huckabee?

title: Iowa Forecast: Judgment Day
description: Caucus Countdown: As of this writing, nine hours and 02 minutes.

title: Late Night Hosts: Howd They Do?
description: Heres the late night lesson: Good writing trumps no writing, but no writing trumps bad, Robert Bianco wrote in USA Today.

title: How Much Is the Weather Channel Worth?
description: Andrew Ross Sorkins report in Thursdays New York Times has generated a flurry of follow-up reports this morning.

title: Romneys Team Assess the G.O.P. Vote
description: DES MOINES  If Republican turnout today is 80,000 or above, Mitt Romneys campaign could be in trouble, according to Doug Gross, Mr. Romneys Iowa campaign chairman.

title: The Primary Issue
description: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.

description: The following is a transcript of Mike Huckabee's address to supporters after the Iowa Caucuses, as provided by Congressional Quarterly via The Associated Press.

description: The following is a transcript of Hillary Rodham Clinton's address to supporters after the Iowa Caucuses, as provided by Congressional Quarterly via The Associated Press.

title: Initial Reaction
description: Is it just my long-time Giants loyalty speaking, or is anyone else wondering how the moniker L.T. was so easily transferred to LaDainian Tomlinson? Bill Brink writes in this weeks Play newsletter. Is it as simple as a decree from SportsCenter or should the standard be higher  say, like transforming the very way the game is played? Thats what the original L.T., Lawrence Taylor, did when he was terrorizing quarterbacks in the 1980s. Tomlinsons superb talent is unquestioned, and he seems sure to eventually join Taylor in the Hall of Fame. But he doesnt have two Super Bowl rings, hasnt willed his team to greatness, and most importantly hasnt fundamentally altered strategy on the other side of the line of scrimmage. Lets reserve that nickname for their rightful owner!

title: Thursday Kickoff: One for Stew
description: How impressive was West Virginias dismantling of Oklahoma in the Fiesta Bowl? Well, it apparently got Bill Stewart a job. Dave Hickman of the Charleston Gazette reports that West Virginia will announce today that Stewart is Rich Rodriguezs successor. ESPN.coms Pat Forde talked to a source that said if Stewart met certain incentive clauses in his contract, he could almost make Rod money. Forde also talked to several players who threw their support behind Stewart being hired as the new head coach. Hickmans colleague Mitch Vingle takes time to reflect on the Mountaineers accomplishment, especially in light of the distractions that surrounded Rodriguezs departure.

title: Paying People for the Costs of Climate Control (Part 2)
description: I started off the year writing about a new plan for making deep, sustained cuts in greenhouse-gas emissions while compensating the public for the hit to pocketbooks from higher energy costs. The plan, called Cap and Dividend, was conceived by Peter Barnes, an inventor of socially responsible investment funds and author of Who Owns the Sky? He says cap and trade schemes like the one in the Kyoto Protocol and various climate bills under consideration in Congress do little, if anything, to help the poor and middle class. He also cites problems with a straight tax on carbon content of fuels. (Grist recently explored an earlier iteration of Mr. Barness idea.)

title: For the Moment | On the Road Again
description: This weeks guest bloggers are Loden Dager, a mens wear collective based in New York City that launched in the Fall of 2006 and this week won the Ecco Domani Fashion Foundation award for new talent. Its members, pictured, are: Melissa Vail, Matthew Sandager, Oliver Helden, Paul Marlow, and Alex Galan. This week Loden Dager writes from the road as they journey South in search of inspiration. Today they continue to devour the local influences and junk food. (Read previous blog entries written by Loden Dager and a profile of Alex Galan here.)

title: A Chilly Candidate for Deal Deathwatch
description: Not that long ago, Wall Streets favorite parlor game was speculating about the next leveraged buyout target. These days, the guessing has turned to which buyout deal will be the next to die.

title: Gone So Long We Forgot to Miss You
description: If it werent so ridiculous, youd almost have to admire the quixotic, archaic, almost misanthropic way that college football organizes its postseason, which, after all, is theoretically the most exciting portion of its schedule, Will Leitch writes in this weeks Play newsletter. Essentially, college football builds up an avalanche of momentum, then pauses and says, Hey, everybody, lets take a month off!

title: You Can Still Dump the Body in New Jersey
description: Heres the bulk of Jay Lenos monologue Wednesday night, on his return to the air without the help of striking writers: Folks, lets get right to it. A Jew, a Christian, and a Muslim, walk into a bar. The Jew says to the Muslim  See, I have no idea what they say because theres a writers strike. We dont know what they say.

title: Scent Notes | Chlo by Chlo
description: Perfumers are hired to create perfumes by fashion houses, whose creative teams, usually a group of marketers, direct the perfumers in making the juices: a little sweeter, please, no, less floral, can you boost the wood in the dry-down? They also make the final call  Its this one  and theres the perfume. Perfume-making thus functions very much according to the weakest link theory: the scent is only as good as any given team members worst decision.

title: Barack Obamas Caucus Speech
description: The following is a transcript of Senator Barack Obama's address to supporters after the Iowa Caucuses, as provided by Congressional Quarterly via The Associated Press.

title: Giuliani Wouldnt Go for a Ride
description: BEDFORD, N.H.  Given that Rudolph Giuliani would probably not risk saying anything new or unexpected, the one hope of the media horde as he spoke to voters at the Segway scooter factory was that he would take the machine for a spin  the perfect photo op.

title: The Amazing Kreskin on 2008 and Stacy Peterson
description: Of course, hes right on both counts. On Dec. 25, The Associated Press concluded (without the help of psychics) that there remained many intriguing questions  but few answers in the disappearance of Stacy Peterson, the young wife of a retired police sergeant in Bolingbrook, Ill. The case has dragged on unsolved since she vanished Oct. 28.

title: Chris Dodds Caucus Speech
description: The following is a transcript of Senator Christopher J. Dodds address to supporters after the Iowa Caucuses, as provided by the Dodd campaign.

title: Those Who Left the Ice in 2007
description: Many hockey figures, young and old, passed away in 2007. Some were internationally renowned, some were locally famous and some appeared only briefly in hockeys lower ranks, but all were and always will be part of the game. The roll call below of those departed was compiled by the Society for International Hockey Research, and biographies of each man and woman can be found at the SIHR web site.

title: Tips on Visiting Petra Without a Tour Group
description: We are interested in visiting Jordan in January and wonder how difficult it is to visit Petra. We would like to do this independently, combined with a tour of Egypt, perhaps on our own.

title: Mitt Romneys Caucus Speech
description: The following is a transcript of Mitt Romneys address to supporters after the Iowa Caucuses, as provided by Congressional Quarterly via The Associated Press.

title: How Much for a Firefox I.P.O.?
description: Analysts and pundits have already speculated about how much hot Web phenoms such as Facebook would be worth if and when they go public. Now, Henry Blodget  he of the $400 Amazon.com stock prediction  has trained his eye on one of the browsers used to view those sites.

title: Mob Rule Brings Higher Quality at Gawker
description: UPDATED

title: Live, from Des Moines, Its Thursday Night
description: Dont overdose on political coverage just yet: at least five television networks will feature Iowa caucus coverage Thursday night.

title: Help Is on the Way for New Jersey Train Problems
description: Updated, 4:02 p.m. | This mornings trip into New York turned into an obstacle course for thousands of New Jersey commuters after a downed power line stalled New Jersey Transit trains and a series of fires and mishaps stalled PATH service near Hoboken. But officials hope to have the problems fixed in time for the evening rush; PATH service was restored around noon.

title: When Movies Dont Live Up to the Trailer
description: I cant tell you how much I love the Internet Movie Database (imdb.com). I love The Timess movie reviews too, but I dont always agree with them. The wisdom of the masses on IMDB -- thousands of peoples collective grade for a movie on a 1-to-10 scale -- very rarely misses.

title: Transparency: The New Black?
description: Over on DesignObserver.com, theres furious and fascinating debate about Steven Hellers contention  Heller is the Book Reviews former art director, and now its Visuals columnist  that bloggers (and those who comment on those blogs) should not hide behind anonymity.

title: Goldman Sachs, the Unstoppable Deal Machine
description: The landscape for mergers and buyouts shifted drastically last summer, but one theme remained constant in 2007: If there was a big deal, Goldman Sachs was probably involved. As in previous years, the firm was the top adviser on mergers as measured by dollar volume, both globally and for deals with targets in the United States. It also ranked near the top of the heap as a participant, through its private equity arm, in leveraged buyouts.

title: Silver Wont Quit His Second Job
description: The Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver, was asked today whether he might follow the lead of the State Senate majority leader, Joseph L. Bruno, and give up his own second job, as a lawyer at Weitz & Luxenberg, one of the largest personal injury firms in the state.

title: Matchup for the Orange Bowl
description: ORANGE BOWL8 P.M., No. 8 Kansas (11-1) vs. No. 3 Virginia Tech (11-2), Miami, FOXAnnouncers: Kenny Albert, Daryl Johnston, and Barry Alvarez

title: Even Without Writers, Leno Tops Letterman
description: Although David Letterman had writers on Wednesday night and Jay Leno officially did not, Mr. Leno managed to draw the higher ratings, as he normally does, according to initial Nielsen Media Research ratings.

title: The Insider | Porochista Khakpour
description: (Brian Frank)The Insider is a recurring profile of emerging tastemakers in the fields of fashion, design, food, travel and the arts. Here the breakthrough novelist Porochista Khakpour shares with T a few of her stylish essentials.

title: When Movies Dont Live Up to the Trailer
description: I cant tell you how much I love the Internet Movie Database (imdb.com). I love The Timess movie reviews too, but I dont always agree with them. The wisdom of the masses on IMDB  thousands of peoples collective grade for a movie on a 1-to-10 scale  very rarely misses.

title: The QB Most Likely to Succeed?
description: The N.F.L. playoffs feature three quarterbacks likely to rank among the all-time greats: Brett Favre, Tom Brady and Peyton Manning. Which of the younger quarterbacks in the postseason  David Garrard, Eli Manning, Philip Rivers, Ben Roethlisberger, Tony Romo, Vince Young  would you most like to have lead your team, and why?

title: Romney: Dont Touch the Hair!
description: DES MOINES  Mitt Romney, who has been urged to loosen up his stiff corporate persona a bit, made a bit of an uncharacteristic joke at his own expense Thursday morning in one of his last appearances before Republicans head to their caucus sites.

title: Report from Iowa: Democracy It Aint
description: Des Moines

title: A Star Player by Any Other Name
description: Is it just my long-time Giants loyalty speaking, or is anyone else wondering how the nickname L.T. was so easily transferred to LaDainian Tomlinson? Is it as simple as a decree from SportsCenter or should the standard be higher  say, like transforming the very way the game is played?

title: Parcells Dolphins Continue to Take Shape
description: One day after hiring Jeff Ireland away from the Cowboys to be the Dolphins general manager, Bill Parcells fired Coach Cam Cameron, who went 1-15 in his first season in Miami. Ireland had this to say of Cameron at his news conference this morning:

title: Pogue on CNBC
description: Hey, it occurred to me that I havent yet blogged about my new gig on CNBC.

title: Marsh to Reorganize Amid Deal Speculation
description: Shares of Marsh & McLennan rose Thursday, extending the previous days gains, following a report that a key executive at its insurance brokerage unit had resigned and that a reorganization of the group was imminent.

title: Is Obama a Plan B for Richardson Voters?
description: Barack Obamas drive to win tonights Iowa caucuses is getting a boost from two of his putative rivals. After earlier winning the support of Dennis Kucinich, Obamas campaign has reached an agreement with Bill Richardson for the second-choice votes of Richardson supporters in caucuses where the New Mexico governor cant clear the threshold for competition, according to a senior Obama campaign adviser. The adviser estimated that the deal puts Mr. Obama in position to claim support from roughly half of the 15 percent of Democratic caucus-goers expected to support second-tier candidates.

title: Hillary and the Frog: An Update
description: DES MOINES  Earlier this week, we reported on Senator Hillary Rodham Clintons fondness for an analogy comparing the dependence of the United States on foreign oil to boiling a frog. Her point is that when oil prices are lowered, U.S. consumers and politicians become blas about becoming more energy self-sufficient  just as a frog might be complacent and not realize it is being boiled to death if the water temperature is raised slowly.

title: Bank of America: Weve Still Got Soap
description: Its no secret that Bank of America has been cutting back on its expenses in the wake of its subprime-related losses. But judging from some reports in the week after Christmas, the firm seemed to have become unusually Grinch-like in its efforts.

title: Call the Cops  I Mean, the Bobbies
description: The United Kingdom could soon hear the tune  familiar to Law & Order fans  of dun dun.

title: Its Cold, Yes, but Not Even a Record
description: Everybodys talking about how cold it is today, but there is nothing unusual going on  its finally winter.

title: Open Caucus: Eyes on the Races
description: Several members of our Open Caucus group have been intently following the goings-on in Iowa and New Hampshire, weighing their choices and also watching as the larger-state primaries loom closer to their homes.

title: A Setup Even YOU Could Finish
description: Kristian Huselius turns a couple of Rangers into pylons and Jarome Iginla does the honors.

title: Antonio Mancini: Nineteenth-Century Italian Master
description: Images from the show at the Philadelphia Museum of Art.

title: Twitter, Firefox and Big Ideas That Are Small Companies
description: There is an interesting discussion on the blogosphere about the business prospects of Twitter, the microblogging service. Another discussion is brewing over whether Mozilla, the organization behind the Firefox browser, should go public.

title: Overstock, Redux
description: One thing I like about Patrick Byrne, the chief executive of Overstock.com, is his willingness to engage in plain talk. (There are a few things I dont much like, including his assumption of a conspiracy involving everyone who criticizes his company, but its a new year and I want to start it off on a positive note.)

title: Hoping Coos and Eye Contact Can Thwart Autism
description: A first-of-its-kind autism prevention study will test whether high-risk babies are helped by extra eye contact and attention from parents.

title: Who Is Threatening the Pastors?
description: Hours before the Iowa Republican caucus, Mike Huckabee said that his campaign was considering requesting a federal investigation of reports that several Iowa pastors who back him have received anonymous letters threatening them with penalties or even jail if they use their positions to support a presidential candidate. Mr. Huckabee, a former Southern Baptist minister before he became governor of Arkansas, is banking on heavy turnout from conservative Christians as he battles his rival Mitt Romneys vastly better financed and organized get-out-the-vote operation.

title: Tibetan Arms and Armor at the Met
description: Images from the show at the Metropolitan Museum.

title: Going For the Gold
description: DES MOINES  It was probably only a matter of time, but former Gov. Mitt Romney of Massachusetts is breaking out the Olympic metaphors. Mr. Romney, who ran the 2002 Games in Salt Lake City, said during a visit to Johnston Tuesday that he anticipated either getting the gold or the silver in Iowa.

title: More Olympics Metaphors
description: DES MOINES  Speaking of the Olympics, an infamous name from games past has been popping up on the trail in recent days: None other than Tonya Harding, the ice-skater known for having enlisted a band of goons to injure her rival, Nancy Kerrigan, by clubbing her on the knee with a metal baton.

title: From Taj Mahal, More Bad News About the Dollar
description: The surging rupee is the latest currency to put on a public display of dominance over the dollar:

title: City Cuts Employee Parking Privileges
description: Following months of embarrassing reports on the blogopshere and in the news about city employees abusing their parking privileges, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg announced today that the city would reduce the number of parking placards issued to city workers by at least 20 percent as of March 1.

title: When a Shack Burger Sounds Good, but Not That Good
description: What were reading elsewhere

title: CBS Clarifies Wallaces Account of Clemens Interview
description: UPDATED: In a statement, CBS attempted to clarify Mike Wallaces characterization of an interview with Roger Clemens for 60 Minutes. Read the news story including new quotes from Wallaces interview with Clemens here.

title: Man Uniteds Silvestre: Joey Barton Needs Help
description: We caught up with Mikael Silvestre, the injured Manchester United defender, on Wednesday, hours before he returned home with his family to England after their holiday in New York.

title: Law and Order Still Delivers for NBC
description: Sure, its in its eighteenth season, but Law & Order on NBC remains a ratings force to be reckoned with: its two-hour debut on Wednesday drew the largest audience for the night, 13.4 million viewers, according to Nielsens estimates. NBC won the night overall in total viewers, leading the 8 p.m. hour with its game show Deal or No Deal (12.2 million).

title: Why Iowa Wants to Be First
description: So just how much have the candidates been spending to campaign in Iowa?

description: CONGRATULATIONS ON SELECTING SEAT 21C! This manual is intended to familiarize you with the many options available to you.

description: City Room was a bit surprised to get an e-mail pitch in late December from a public-relations company promoting the Freemasons in connection with the release of Disneys new movie, National Treasure 2: Book of Secrets.

title: The War For Whatever
description: Image found here.

title: Ex-Goldman Associate Is Sentenced in Insider Trading Case
description: A former Goldman Sachs associate accused of masterminding one of the most unusual insider-trading conspiracies in recent memory, one that reaped about $6.7 million, was sentenced Thursday to nearly five years in prison.

title: Or At Least Channel Surf
description: One more reason to watch the Orange Bowl instead: Dick Polman, national political columnist for the Philadelphia Inquirer, notes on his personal blog that the winner of the Iowa caucuses almost never becomes president of the United States.

description: While all the cable news networks will be talking about the Iowa caucus results Thursday night, C-SPAN will be the only channel showing live coverage of actual caucuses.

title: WJC Semifinals: 4 for the Gold
description: A year ago, Carey Price, Marc Staal, Kris Letang, Jonathan Toews, Sam Gagner and Andrew Cogliano were about to suit up for Canada and Erik Johnson, Jack Johnson, Patrick Kane and Peter Mueller of the U.S. team were preparing to go against Canada in a World Junior Championship semifinal in Sweden. If you guessed that the common element among all those names is that they all graduated this season to the NHL, give yourself a pat on the back.

title: Outsourced Wombs
description: The voice was commanding, slightly disdainful and officious.

title: Giuliani Finds Comfort, If Not Warmth in Florida
description: HIALEAH, Fla.  Rudolph W. Giuliani had a rally Thursday evening to celebrate some of that first-in-the-nation voting  here in Florida. Were here to tell you that I know the voting has already begun in Florida, the absentee balloting, he said.

title: Democrats C.I.A. Tape Warning Is Declassified
description: When the C.I.A.s destruction of several interrogation tapes was revealed for the first time, many bloggers reserved much of their vitriol for Democrats who were consulted beforehand.

title: The Iowa Caucuses
description: John Harwood previews the Iowa caucuses.

title: Googles Free 411 Service Heads Mainstream
description: In an earlier post about a new mobile search service from ChaCha, I noted that free 411 services like those offered by Google, Microsoft and others are not well know. In fact, informal surveys done by Sterling Market Intelligence suggest that three quarters of consumers are unfamiliar with these services.

title: The View From Nevada
description: NEVADA, Iowa  Welcome to Nevada 2 otherwise known as the second precinct in Nevada, Iowa, where we will be reporting tonight from the Democratic caucus here. Its our second visit this week: check out this video, which will show you the preparations for tonights caucus.

title: Digital S.L.R.'s for $1,500
description: David Pogue reviews four cameras that can satisfy the almost-pro who is beyond the point-and-shoots.

description: DERRY, N.H.  This may be the last time Senator John McCain has the entire stage of New Hampshire to himself.

title: NOLA and punditry
description: Im in New Orleans for The Meetings, as every economist calls them. I havent been out much yet (its freezing), but what Ive seen looks depressing  and thats the tourist area.

title: Kenyan Opposition Rally Blocked
description: In Nairobi, Kenya's capital, riot police pushed back thousands of opposition supporters who poured into the streets to answer a call for a million-person rally that had been banned by the government.

title: Quote: What Price a Grandchilds Affection?
description: When oil hit $100 a barrel for the first time on Wednesday, something seemed out of whack. Trading volume was low and OPEC was quick to say that it was not our fault. And then The Financial Times reported that it was one man:

title: Facebook, Robert Scoble and Free Love
description: If Facebook wanted more bad blog coverage it couldnt have done a better job than picking on Robert Scoble, the publicity-seeking blogger. Mr. Scoble was kicked off of Facebook because he used a preview version of a Plaxo service that logged onto his Facebook account to download the names and e-mail addresses of his friends.

title: The Fatigue Factor
description: As the time for the Iowa caucuses approaches, the candidates are exhausted. Their defenses are lowered and glimmers of their less-guarded selves emerge.
