Thompson Jr., the New York City comptroller, has raised the most money so far in the quest for the Democratic nomination for mayor in 2009, but United States Representative Anthony D. During that period, Mr. Thompson raised slightly more than $1 million, bringing the amount he has raised for the campaign to $4.2 million. title: An Environmentally Friendly Route From Kennedy Airport to Manhattan

For example, I would like to know if landing at 8 a.m. at JFK would allow me to take the train into Manhattan to make a 9:30 meeting. Visitors tend to fall back on the expensive and often inconvenient plane-to-cab or plane-to-rental car because at least you have some sense of control. But this isnt always the fastest and it is certainly not the most environmentally responsible. Can you tell Im a Prius driver?

title: Can Cruise Ships and Coral Coexist?
description: [UPDATE, 2/15/09: Our Green Traveler column has provided an update assessing a long list of environmental impacts from cruise ships.] The cruise ship industry, Mexican government, and Conservation International have announced a plan to try to protect coral reefs and other ecosystems in Cozumel, the worlds most-visited cruise destination.[UPDATED 1/15 below]In a joint news release, the industry, environmental group, and government officials said their goals are to boost environmental education of passengers, cruise operators, and local communities, curb traffic and waste-disposal problems, boost protection of the barrier reef, and work to more effectively enforce environmental laws and regulations.

title: Which Buyout Firms Were Quickest to Cash Out?
description: Most shareholders like dividends  just ask a Citigroup investor  but creditors generally arent big fans. This is especially true of the special dividends that private equity firms like to pay to themselves, sometimes just a few months after a leveraged buyout is complete. This sudden outflow of cash can be deeply annoying to bondholders worried about the quality of their debt, which is why Moodys Investors Service decided to examine which private equity firms tend to be quickest on the draw when it comes to dividends.

title: Stimulus? Never mind

title: By Hook or By Crook

There is a Plan A (no strike) and a Plan B (the strike is still on), but regardless, his crew is building sets, laying out the show and have no plans to cancel or reschedule.

title: Vendors Want More Permits, Not Just Green Ones
description: In the No Good Deed Goes Unpunished category, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg came up with a plan to provide fresh fruits and vegetables to low-income New Yorkers, and he got hit with rotten tomatoes from city street vendors. The mayors plan  to provide an extra 1,500 cart permits for vendors willing to sell produce in neighborhoods underserved by grocery stores  has been widely hailed by public health advocates. The citys Department of Health and Mental Hygiene says it will make it easier for an estimated 100,000 residents to buy vegetables.
