title: New Owners for Au Bon Pain
description: Au Bon Pain, which runs a chain of bakery cafes, said Wednesday it would sell itself to a private equity firm, LNK Partners, and the restaurant chains management as part of a recapitalization that includes a $100 million equity investment from LNK.

title: BEA Accepts $8.5 Billion Bid From Oracle
description: Oracle said Wednesday that it would finally acquire BEA Systems, an enterprise software maker, for about $8.5 billion in cash.

title: Carlyle Said to Be in Talks for Booz Allen Unit
description: Booz Allen Hamilton, the consulting firm, is in discussions to sell its government contracting business to the Carlyle Group and several other private equity firms for about $2 billion, people briefed on the discussions told DealBook.

title: Citigroup Loss Raises Economic Anxiety
description: Citigroups staggering fourth-quarter loss of $9.83 billion and its sobering economic forecast about the housing market are likely to amplify the anxiety of consumers and workers  who are already concerned that the mortgage crisis could plunge the economy into a recession. Adding to worries, the government reported Tuesday that retail sales in December declined for the first time since 2002.

title: Tips on Post Vacation Re-entry
description: I returned from a two-week vacation yesterday, and before I left I promised myself I was going to try to carry my holiday mood with me as I eased back into work. So I did something I thought would help. I wrote my post-vacation entry before I went on vacation. I did it for two reasons: I wanted to make sure I didnt have a deadline my first day back at work. But I also wanted to come home and read a good post on getting organized again.

Stu VanAirsdale talks with the director of Half Nelson about Sugar, his latest film. It tells the tale of a minor league baseball player from the Dominican Republic whose field of dreams ends up being a corn field in Iowa.

title: AWYM
description: As a Sundance rookie last year, the Bagger all but hazed himself, spending so much time chasing down videos and leads that he caught only 3.5 flicks (the .5 comes from having had the sense to walk out on The Ten, the unfunny take-off on the Commandments). He saw The Savages, but missed Once. He showed up late for overcommitted movies and spent too many hours at parties full of the same vacant eyed twits that L.A. and N.Y.C. are lousy with.

title: Taxes and revenues  another history lesson
description: One thing Im hearing a lot lately is the old line that tax cuts actually increase revenues, sometimes accompanied by a few out-of-context numbers. So a bit more history plus chart on all that.

title: Snow Blind
description: The Bagger is trading in his Monolo Blahniks for some Sorels and leaving behind strike-addled Los Angeles for Sundance, a place where cinematic dreams are mercilessly crushed by carnal industry types take wing. Having just checked the forecast, the Bagger thought it would be good to head up a day early and lay down some tracks in the fantastic powder at Alta pursuit of great stories for the Little Shop of Horrors.

title: Yanks Struggling Abroad
description: At the start of the English Premier League Season, there were a total of 11 American players on the first-team rosters of six different clubs. Thats an impressive figure  enough for a full starting side, if you could start three goalkeepers  in arguably the best (or at least the most exciting) league in the world.

title: Flat Housing Market Adds to Tax Pressure
description: The robust growth in real estate values in New York, a trend that helped fuel years of record budget surpluses and city spending, has nearly skidded to a halt, and that shift could bring new pressure on Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg to raise taxes, Diane Cardwell and Ray Rivera report. The city estimates that when it conducts its annual valuation of all property in the city in May, it will be just 1.44 percent more than the last assessment, the smallest gain since the beginning of the Bloomberg administration. In recent years, the city seemed insulated from dips in the national real estate market, posting several double-digit gains, including an 18 percent increase in values last year. But now, according to data from the tentative annual assessment roll, which will largely determine taxes for the fiscal year beginning in July, declining values of small homes outside Manhattan are pulling down the overall market as the effects of the countrys mortgage trouble take hold.

title: The Background on Blue Ribbon
description: In my telephone conversations with the Bromberg brothers over recent days, as I fact-checked this weeks review on the newest Blue Ribbon restaurant, I was reminded of the background of the Blue Ribbon brood, a background thats pretty interesting. There wasnt enough space in the review to share much of it.

description: Lifecore Biomedical announced Tuesday that it had agreed to be acquired by affiliates of Warburg Pincus for $17 a share in cash in a transaction valued at about $239 million. But the deal is not your usual private equity transaction.

description: On Wednesdays, this blog is the delivery vehicle for Living With Music, a playlist of songs from a writer or some other kind of book-world personage.

title: Prelude to a Public Toilet: Thank This Man
description: One lawsuit, 17 years, and 443 relieved users later, Douglas Lasdon is pleased that New Yorkers were able to use thepublic toilet that he had dreamed of in 1990.Mr. Lasdon, who has worked as a homeless advocate through the Urban Justice Center, first brought the issue of public toilets to the citys consciousness, when his group filed a lawsuit in 1990 on behalf of three homeless men and one woman who, it was said, were forced to endure continual embarrassment, humiliation, physical injury and hazardous conditions resulting from defendants violations.

title: Oscar Bulks Up
description: The 80th Academy Awards poster is out. It features a very buff and tough guy named Oscar, who apparently backs up for no one, including picketing writers. The Bagger has always wondered what is hidden under Oscars folded arms. Maybe its a Glock.

We are going from L.A., where things are a bit, um, unsettled, to Sundance. From entropy to birth.

The Toro Rosso team has been wrestling in its press releases on how to deal with having two drivers named Sebastienor Sebastian. Yes, Frenchman Bourdais and German Vettel have given them quite a challenge. They have been trying to resolve the problem with parentheses and all manner of ideas. title: Inside the Giants: Big Game Means More Chairs
description: The windowless concrete-block room in the bowels of Giants Stadium where reporters do their daily work is usually as sparsely populated as it is depressing. But it is easy to tell how big a game the Giants will play Sunday by the number of chairs set up.

title: The Endless Fear of Terrorism
description: Ive written about weather alarmism and terrorphobia as examples of availability cascades, but theres an important distinction between these cascades. The environmentalists promoting fear of climate change sometimes use dubious tactics in exploiting images like Hurricane Katrina, but they can legitimately point to longer trends showing that the planet has warmed and is projected to warm further, affecting everyone on Earth.

title: Wide Open Races
description: The Republican and Democratic fields remain unsettled, John Harwood, of CNBC and The New York Times, reports.

title: Study Finds Changes in Who Uses Food Stamps
description: About one in seven New York City residents  some 1.1 million people  receive food stamps, the federally financed benefit created in 1964 to reduce hunger and malnutrition for the poor. The average monthly benefit in 2006 was around $113.

title: The Mac Daddy Formula
description: A lot of buzz still surrounds Apple chief Steve Jobs and his keynote address, with David Pogue and CNBC's Melissa Francis.

title: In Istanbul, an Electrifying Exhibit
description: Not too long ago, the shores of the Golden Horn, a waterway linked to the mighty Bosporus and the Marmara Sea, seemed downright derelict in parts. Few visitors included it on their itineraries and those who did made a beeline to the Pierre Loti Cafe high in the hills. Those on longer stays might eventually have added the Rami Ko Museum of Industry or the kitschy wonder known as Miniaturk.

title: Hospitals See Rise in Flu-Related Visits
description: Somethings going around. The statement  a staple of water-cooler conversation and cubicle chitchat  appears to be grounded in truth, for the moment. The average daily number of flu-related emergency room visits increased by 19 percent from November to last week, the citys Department of Health and Mental Hygiene announced today. This is separate from the novovirus, or stomach flu, that the department warned about last month.

title: The White House and the Whales
description: [UPDATE 10/9: The Supreme Court is mulling the relative rights of whales and the White House and Navy.] The fight over how humans should, and should not, interact with whales has moved from the waters off Antarctica, where environmental campaigners have been harassing Japanese whalers, to the White House.

title: Meet Lala Guimares
description: Name: Lala GuimaresHome base: Rio de JaneiroAge: 57Occupation: Public relationsRetail standbys: Osklen for everything, especially long dresses and accessories; Lenny for pre-, post- and during the beach. Its not that difficult to make a bikini, but she takes it to another level of sophistication.Provisions: My health is really important to me, so Zona Sul for the freshest organic vegetables and fruits.Escape route: Buzios. It has all different kinds of beaches: rocky, sandy, surfy, big, small. Its very close to Rio, so its easy to get to, and once youre there its magical.Party central: Londra at the Fasano. The dcor is very dark and British, like an old club or library. The walls are decorated with old album covers, from bands like the Who and the Rolling Stones.Cocktail: Water.Restaurant: Fasano Al Mare . The food and service are excellent, but more importantly its in front of the sea, which is rare for restaurants in Rio.Bookshop: Livraria Travessa. They have a huge variety and you can find most anything you need or want in one location.Flip-flops: Havaianas. I collect them. Theyre very democratic shoes. Whether its the working class, or those who live in the favelas or those with money, everybody has them. I love them because you can wear them to a party and no one bats an eye.

title: Clinton on Economic Stimulus Plan
description: CNBC interviews Hillary Rodham Clinton on her economic stimulus plan.

title: Theyll Be Happier About the Result
description: Aired Tuesday night on NBC: Of course, the biggest story of all, American Idol is back on the air, and more Americans will participate in American Idol than in the election of our next president. Thats a true fact. And theyll be happier about the result.

title: He Is Planning To Invade Wisconsin
description: Aired Tuesday night on CBS: The price of milk has gone up 36 percent. Heres what happened. The cows have joined OPEC.

title: Forced Rectal Exam Stirs Ethics Questions
description: Under what circumstances can a patient in an emergency room be forced to submit to a procedure that doctors deem to be medically necessary? That question  and the notion of informed consent  is at the heart of a civil case that is about to go to trial in March in State Supreme Court in Manhattan.Brian Persaud, a 38-year-old construction worker who lives in Brooklyn, asserts that he was forced to undergo a rectal examination after sustaining a head injury in an on-the-job accident at a Midtown construction site on May 20, 2003. Mr. Persaud was taken to the emergency room at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center, where he received eight stitches to his head.

title: Its a Chateau Ripple, Monsieur
description: Neuroscientists monitoring the brains of wine drinkers found that people given two identical red wines got more pleasure from tasting the one they were told cost more. Fascinating. But you may not want to have these scientists to your next tasting, not if their party banter is anything like their study abstract:

title: Hey, Im Doing My Part
description: Aired Tuesday night on NBC: Barack Obama has increased his Secret Service protection, and thats just to protect him from Hillary.

title: Lehman Names Co-Head of Global M&A
description: Lehman Brothers has put a pair of bankers in charge of its worldwide merger advisory business. The New York-based firm said Wednesday that it named Paul G. Parker as global co-head of mergers and acquisitions, a role he will share with Mark Shafir, Lehmans sole head of global M&A since 2003. Mr. Parker had been Lehmans United States head of mergers and acquisitions.

title: Fine Print | Out of the Ordinary
description: Lu Shengzhong, The Book of Humanity:Empty Book (detail), 2005(Chambers Fine Art)

title: Ex-Brocade C.E.O. Sentenced to 21-Month Prison Term
description: The former chief executive of Brocade Communications Systems was sentenced Wednesday to 21 months in prison for orchestrating a scheme to tamper with the companys records of stock option grants.

title: Obamas Twin Ads in Nevada
description: The day after sending two new Spanish-language ads, Hope and Something Is Happening, across Nevada broadcast waves, Barack Obama has two new English TV spots for the state.

title: Thats Not Entertainment
description: If you have ever tried to meditate you may have had my problem: no mantra. It was impossible to find anything that I could repeat in my head for solace. Every word seemed too distinctive or thorny or overly entertaining.

title: Clinton vs. Uncommitted
description: While the Democrats were making nice last night in debate-land, in Las Vegas, a pretty surprising development was unfolding in Michigan. And we dont mean Mitt Romneys win.

title: A Friendly Football Wager: Cheese vs. Cheesecake
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg of New York City and Mayor James J. Schmitt of Green Bay, Wis., just announced a friendly wager on the outcome of the National Football Conference championship game on Sunday evening, when the Giants visit the Green Bay Packers. The winner advances to the Super Bowl on Feb. 3.

title: Reyes to Prison
description: Another chief executive was sentenced today to join the ranks of bosses in jail.

title: Political TV: Edwards Scheduled on Letterman
description: The Democratic presidential candidate John Edwards will appear on The Late Show with David Letterman next Tuesday, CBS announced today.

title: Ratings: Idol Cant Quite Hit The High Note
description: Foxs American Idol came roaring back to prime time television on Tuesday, dominating the nights ratings as usual, but in a sign that support for the series, now in its seventh season, may have softened, this years premiere fell more than 4 million viewers short of last years record-breaking debut.

title: The Mortgage Mess, Apartment Division
description: Terry Pristin has an article in todays Times that should be must reading, about the havoc left by an apartment owner who amassed a lot of buildings, paying himself hefty fees and then letting the buldings rot. The bank that lent him the money securitized the mortgages into CMBS  commercial mortage backed securities. The mortgages are now defaulting at a rapid rate.

title: For The Moment | Francesco Vezzoli
description: This weeks guest blogger is the Milan-based artist and satirist Francesco Vezzoli. Over the past decade, the diva-and-Prada-obsessed Vezzoli, 36, has at once defiled and genuflected at the altar of celebrity. His campy oeuvre includes everything from needlework portraits of Maria Callas and Anna Magnani to films like Trailer for a Remake of Gore Vidals Caligula, starring Helen Mirren and Courtney Love, and live performances like Pirandellos Right You Are (If You Think You Are), starring  among others  Cate Blanchett, Natalie Portman and Abigail Breslin, which he produced at the Guggenheim last October as part of the Performa 07 series. In his third post of the week he writes about the actress Monica Vitti. To read all of Francesco Vezzolis prior blog posts, click here.

title: Seven Deal-Breakers for a Big Airlines Merger
description: Delta Air Lines, Northwest Airlines and UALs United Airlines are all very publicly flirting about a merger pairing either Northwest and Delta or Delta and United. The very public floating of these trial balloons is evidence of the difficulty that any such merger will face.

title: Q & A: Keeping Score on U.S.-Iran Confrontation
description: For all the heads still spinning in the aftermath of a recent incident between the United States Navy and a group of Iranian speedboats in the Strait of Hormuz, lets take it from the top, with the help of Thom Shanker, who covers national security and foreign policy for The New York Times.

title: Afghanistan-Bound Soldiers Say Goodbye to New York
description: Sgt. Jonathan Silberstein has moved to Los Angeles since his New York Army National Guard unit last deployed to Iraq, in 2004, but today he was back in Manhattan, preparing for a new mission, this time in Afghanistan.

title: Everything Is Exactly the Same
description: Aired Tuesday night on The Late Late Show With Craig Ferguson on CBS: You know, the big story is of course the return of American Idol, which has been off the air for seven months. The world has changed so much since then, when bin Laden was at large and Tom Cruise was crazy and this was a show on in the middle of the night and nobody was watching it. Actually, everything is exactly the same.

title: Misspeakin Baseball
description: After hearings on steroids this week, what one blogger is calling the most clueless congressman in Washington flirts with laughingstock status among baseball fans:

title: I Want My Nano!
description: The most disappointing part of the unveiling of the $2,500 car by Indias Tata Motors  outside of it not having a cute name like the Curryvette or the Delhincoln  is that the Nano wont be sold in the United States. A $2,500 new car thats not radio-controlled and I cant buy one? Thats as un-American as making ethanol out of sugar cane.

title: And the Winning Paint Color Goes to
description: This is exactly how it happened:

title: Ruling on Judges Reverberates Across Boroughs
description: The United States Supreme Courts decision upholding the method of selecting State Supreme Court justices is reverberating throughout New Yorks political world.

description: Melena Ryzik attends "Etiquette," a performance piece in the Under the Radar theater festival.

title: Soft Serve | A News Feed of Light Reading
description: Soft Serve scans newspapers, magazines and Web sites for soft news  coverage of products, trends and matters of style. Just the fluff, maam.

title: 49 State Capitols
description: A film of Mr. Fazel's journey through America. Credit: Andrea Caccia and Carlo Cardelli

title: A Home for the 9/11 Survivors Stairway
description: With the new World Trade Center rising clamorously around it, the last standing vestige of the old World Trade Center is about to be uprooted. In the last week, workers have cut openings into a concrete superstructure supporting 38 steps that once led from Vesey Street up to the north end of the sprawling Austin J. Tobin Plaza. Because hundreds of evacuees made their way down this route on Sept. 11, 2001, it is called the survivors stairway.

title: Sorry, The Judges Own Too Much Oil Company Stock to Hear Your Case
description: Big corporations have been winning more than their share of victories lately in Congress and in the courts. But the California Supreme Court may have just brought things to a new low. It turns out that it does not have enough justices without financial interests in oil companies to do their job of meting out justice.

title: Open Season on Jagr
description: With the Rangers playing so far under expectations, it is natural that much of the criticism is leveled at their captain, Jaromir Jagr.

title: Clinton on Economic Stimulus Plan
description: CNBC interviews Sen. Hillary Rodham Clinton on her economic stimulus plan as she campaigns for the democratic presidential nomination.

title: Veering From the Script in Foxborough
description: Hours after our own Judy Battista did an excellent job explaining how the Patriots always seem to stay on message comes the news that Randy Moss has some legal trouble in Florida.

title: Inside the Giants: Chewing the Deer Sausage With Brett Favre
description: Reporters were gathered around a speaker phone when Brett Favres voice arrived. He said hello and apologized because his mouth was full. Coach Mike McCarthy had given Favre some deer sausage.

title: ITunes Movie Rentals and Netflix Online: Different Markets
description: Its easy to wonder whether the recently improved online video feature from Netflix will be hurt by the promotional blitzkrieg that Apple will launch for its iTunes movie rental service.
